Reviews.Title: “My kind of place!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to main drag (5th Avenue) and beach. Small rooms but spotless and quiet. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil haven in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Playa on my own following a friend's wedding in Tulum. Based on a great review in Lonely Planet's guide to the Mayan Riviera and an unbeatable online price, I booked my stay there and I'm so glad I did. It's a beautifully designed hotel, steps away from the beach, 5th Avenue and the town's nightlife. The rooms are elegant and cozy - nice touches like azure bedspreads, smooth rock shower floors and in some, fun open lofts with a winding wooden staircase to the bed. The property has a nice open-air pool with a waterfall wall, at the top of which is a roof deck offering a great view. The staff are friendly, worldly and accommodating. Equally enjoyable for couples and singles.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Kinbe!”
Reviews.Author: mle1616
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a wedding and the Kinbe was recommended to us by the wedding couple. We aren't into the all inclusive thing so once I saw their website and read reviews I knew this was where we wanted to stay. We luckily booked early and got a GREAT room, the garden terrace with a view of the beach and great big deck area. All the rooms are differents shapes and sizes, our friend had a great lofted room and another a regular size room perfect for a couple. A lot of friends from the wedding stayed there, including couples with children and our elderly friends. Our room was cleaned thoroughly everyday. All the front desk staff was friendly, helpful and honest. Our room had a mini fridge which came in very handy. They also have a great, huge rooftop deck I wish we used more. The price was very reasonable and definitely worth it. The decor is warm, welcoming and flourishing with bright greens and flowers. (side note: book your airport transportation with the Kinbe, reasonable price and our driver was waiting for us at the airport, smooth ride to and from the hotel) The location could not be better! To the left is the beach, to the right is the main street, 5th Avenue. We enjoyed the lounging at the Zense (sp?) on their beach chairs. We also enjoyed the cafe past the Starbucks, I believe it's called Sasta, delicious bagels and coffee, much better than Starbucks. The bar kiddie corner from Starbucks was our favorite laid back, grab a night cap kind of a place. We also ate at Fridas a couple times down 5th avenue for lunch. Our dinner at Sur was the best service we had there. We also recommend a day trip to Tulum. It was super easy to catch a shared van/shuttle about 8 minute walk from Kinbe. We opted for a cab back which was about $40, but between 4 of us not bad at all. We explored the ruins and made our way to Playa Paraiso, which is beautiful. Thank you so much to Ian, Elena, Alejandro and the entire staff at Kinbe. You really made our lodging experience relaxing and comfortable. If we're ever back in Playa we'll be sure to stay with you again. Emily

Reviews.Title: “In Town and CLose to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Estebon
Reviews.Content: My trip started at a all inclusive at the Wyndham. After one day of soggy, tasteless food and beds that were so hard it was like sleeping on the floor we decided to move. The hotels policy was liberal and we didnt loose any money. That was nice. There was really not much evening atmoshere and since I was traveling with a old friend we were bored. Staying is town is the opposite as staying at an all inclusive. The people at the Kinbe are really great. They were laid back and local people. Although two of the people who worked there were Italian. Lots of Italians in PDC! Since my friend is a pilot we were offered the largest room with a second floor area with just enough room for a bed. The first floor area is small but it has a really great balcony. The beach is a one minute walk - maybe 150 feet. We bought some food at the restaurant on the right and stayed there all day. Its crowded buy great people watching. The other rooms are small, even for wuropean standards, like a college dorm room. But the large room was kind of cool. First street is up the road 150 feet as well, so you are in the middle of both primary activites downtown. This is a nice boutique hotel with character. Wi Fi is free but doesnt work so great. If you really need wifi then go up to the corner at Starbucks and pay some crazy money for a coffee, but the wifi is good. BTY 3 doors down from Starbucks is a local coffee place, half the price and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kinbe--Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: nancyn34
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel January 2010. This hotel is a good value for the money you pay and is like a "boutique" style hotel. Since it's been 2 years since we stayed at this establishment, I'm sure that they may have done some renovations or improvements. The staff is very helpful, except there it seemed like there was no one on staff in the late hours of the night. It's a very modern looking hotel, there is no pool except for the pool that looks like it's only for looks near the lobby. The hotel is within 2 blocks walking distance to the public beach and you can get beach towels from the front desk. When we got there our room was not ready and they upgraded us to the Garden room. We did not like this room, the bathroom toilet wasn't flushing right, it had a very small flat screen tv, a futon, coffee table and the bedroom was upstairs because it was a loft style room. Not very convenient when you have to use the restroom and have to journey down some wooden stairs. We only stayed in the room one night and they put us in the Moody room. This room was nicer and more spacious. There is a rooftop that you can go to that has chairs and tables, but there is no pool and the view isn't that great. The hotel is in a great location blocks to the beach and the main area for shopping and restaurants. This hotel is a good value for the money that you pay for, which is for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Love KINBE”
Reviews.Author: Carrie D
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Kinbe, we absolutely love this little gem! We love that the beach and main street are literally seconds away. My personal favorite spot at this hotel is the rooftop, it's perfect for sunning and watching the hustle bustle of the streets below. Our room was cleaned everyday and the air-conditioning worked extremely well, we woke up cold and had to turn it off a couple of times! The front desk guys are amazing, they helped us with all of our questions and even helped us out with our Spanish when we had questions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is absolutely gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed”
Reviews.Author: kentmorrdave
Reviews.Content: A very nice building. A new employee took us up 3 flights, over the roof, then down 2 flights to are room, # 29. Everything about the room was nice, except the hard bed. Close to all of 5th ave and the beach, and dive shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly service, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: NorthShore11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Kinbe, and were very pleased with the hotel overall. Pros: location location location (right between 5av and the beach!), interesting design/decor, nice pool, quiet, big comfy bed, very clean, discounts at excellent beach club down the street, let us check in early when we arrived, and had great customer service. Cons: the snower was a little funky (not dirty, but the floor was made up of rocks which was unusual to stand on...). It isn't a swanky place, but still is really good value for the $100-ish you spend per night. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to friends. I might suggest that my parents stay somewhere else since they prefer the high-end type of travel, but for us (no kids, still like to go out and party, not too much time spent in the room) it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Poor Showers”
Reviews.Author: Vakas S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Years 2012. The hotel was clean and nice. The main complaint we had was that the shower had lots of fixture issues. The shower only pumped out cold water and it was hard to get a warm or hot shower. Also the shower water kept spilling out of the shower onto the bathroom and sprayed all over the sink and surrounding area. Inside the shower there all multiple wall mounted showerheads that either don't work or if they do only have a spray of cold water coming out. We also had phone issues. Our phone in the hotel room didn't work the first day. We requested a repair and it was fixed on the second day. But again that night our phone stopped working. The wifi is spotty at best and we had to request them to fix it on multiple occasions. There is no elevator so you have to climb up a few stories of stairs to get to your room. Carrying up our luggage was a hastle, although the front desk man did help carry a bag up. We asked to repair the showerheads and they did attempt to fix them but we still had cold/lukewarm water most days. There were no ocean views. Their is a manmade wall of water which was not turned on most days until around 8 pm or so. It usually was shut off around 10 pm. The AC is a wall unit that worked very well. The bathroom has a european style toilet built into the wall. It frequently would get clogged or require multiple flushes to work. The walls to the next rooms are close by and if you are trying to get rest in the morning you will be awoken from the slamming of the doors of the surrounding hotel rooms. The balcony is very unsafe as it is supported by a frail metal bar and wood pieces.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Wazdoggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Kinbe for 3 nights between Christmas and New Year and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always up for a chat, and the room was comfortable without being overly luxurious. It was well priced (relatively speaking for this time of year) and good value for money especially given the fantastic location, just 50 metres or so from the beach, opposite a whole selection of dive shops and right by 5th Avenue. The in room airconditioner was excellent, and the pool looked nice (although we never used it as the beach is 50 metres away!). The only minor thing worth noting was that the water (and especially the hot water) in the shower in our room was only a trickle, not much pressure at all but we didn't really need a hot shower so we didn't bring it up until check out. Breakfast wasn't included but we used the discount vouchers (10% off etc) at the nearby beach clubs and put brekky towards our tab at the club to get a free chair. Oh one thing - we hadn't taken note when we booked and didn't know there was a rooftop terrace until I just read some trip advisor reviews now! No one at reception told us when we checked in and there were no signs or indications anywhere so make sure you check it out. We hope we will be able to visit Playa in the future and would definitely stay at Kinbe again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ishq-rose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is striking in its appearance with minimalist furniture, its art, pool and set inside a jungle garden. It is attractive and therefore a calming place to stay. The staff on the whole were friendly and attentive and provided us with discount vouchers and local knowledge. Our room was fine, spotless and had a very comfortable king size bed, and the shower was excellent and always had hot water. We stayed for a week over Christmas and were not disappointed. It is well placed to explore everywhere and easy access to the ADO and collectivos to get you out of the bustle of Playa if required, or 50 metres from the beach and beach clubs for breakfast. My only gripe about the stay was our toiletries were not replaced every day and I had to request them a couple of times, which was inconvenient. I agree with the below reviewer if a hot tub was on the roof that would have been a bonus. However these are merely observations rather than complaints and we really enjoyed our stay at Kinbe in Playa - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: mayaruinsonly
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times in the past and have no complaints at all. I enjoy the closeness to the beach and the staff is always very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, close to the beach but really bad internet.”
Reviews.Author: mixmaak
Reviews.Content: Everything was pretty ok in the room, very small room but clean and at a very good price. The place is really close to the beach, the only problem was the internet, very slow and sometimes there was no sign at all...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: zaachilalady
Reviews.Content: Our room that overlooked the cascading pool was quiet and refreshing. Jan, the staff on duty, upgraded us to this room for just $6 US a day. When we needed to leave a day early due to a family member being ill, Jan worked this out for us. Loved the location, just off the beach and 5th Avenue. The room was a bit small for a business traveler (I was working on a project), but for those coming just to vacation, it was lovely and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel, great location for Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: checo
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, nice rooms just what you need nothing more, good quiality. I think we paid less than $120 per night, not bad for what you get. Pool & includes access to near beach club. Nice place to sleep, one block away from 5th ave @ Starbucks corner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be taken in by the coolness”
Reviews.Author: Klipzlskim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very disappointing. It looked cool in the photos, and it does in person too, but the rooms are not nearly as nice as the lobby. Our room was tiny, it smelled bad (something emanating from the shower drain), and there was no peace at all. There were a lot of partiers staying there, who stumbled loudly up the stairs late at night, and then stumbled loudly down the stairs early in the morning to catch a cab to the airport. We could also hear music and shouting from the local clubs. There’s also no parking anywhere nearby unless you get super lucky. On the plus side, it’s a block and a half from the beach and the price wasn’t bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location in downtown Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Olaf T
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel downtown! Close to beach – just a 30 seconds walk away. I booked this hotel online not knowing what I will have, but I was pleasantly surprised. I went for a Moody room with balcony and so the room assigned to me was not big, but enough and had a nice view to the beautiful garden! Kinbe is a lovely hotel just a 2 minutes walk from the restaurants, markets and nightlife. Still good protected against the noise during the night. Staff were super friendly/helpful and my room was clean all the time. The hotel has a small pool with waterfall although I didn't use it as the beach was so close. ;-) The free WIFI was great as well. Take the breakfast voucher, as you will have the pleasure to take it in an Beach Resort close to the Kinbe – I really recommend this for a good start in your day!! I will come back to the Kinbe… of course!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Kinbe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steadman3
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice hotel in Playa Del Carmen. My wife, my daughter and I stay there for 3 nights. We had a "Garden" room that had, a king size bed upstairs in the loft, a fold out bed in the lower level, and a small balcony, that was perfect for those chill out times. Courtyard, ground are extremely relaxing. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The beach was 3 minutes away and the mamin drag 5th Ave, is 30 yards in the opposite direction. The negative comments we have are, there should be a full lenth mirror somewhere in the room, and anothte light for the lower level. As others have said, this is a cute, yet perfect hotel for Playa Del Carmen vistors. Oh and yes...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: ginsberg300
Reviews.Content: Lovely quirky hotel. We stayed in one of the new rooms overlooking the pool and would recommend this place to anyone. The room was very modern with a nice balcony containing wooden patio furniture. The bathroom had a fantastic shower with 5 jets and really nice toiletries. The beach is 2 minutes round the corner and Alex on reception was very friendly and helpful. If you’re looking for a trendy hotel with a personality I would book into Hotel Kinbe

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hanswijk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at 50m of the Beach. We stayed here 5 years ago and it's a perfect place to stay when you are in Playa. Rooms and hotel are nicely decorated

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Stay here! Its the best!”
Reviews.Author: mayecontreras
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel in the Lonely Planet : Mayan Riviera, I went directly to it once arriving from Tulum and the treatment was excelent! Top reasons to stay: 1. Location: the best beaches, restaurants and 5th Avenue 2. Rooms: clean, excelent shower with cryspy clean water, perfect minibar. 3. Price: the price was very accesable for this classy hotel. Do yourself a favor and stay here! The staff is very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie_Line_8
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel with very nice pool and garden. Only the breakfast place is a bit far away and the person at the front desk doing the checkout was not as friendly as the other staff members (calling somebody to check the minibar in front of us, e.g.).

Reviews.Title: “peace”
Reviews.Author: luciano_frezza
Reviews.Content: a hotel where feel the peace on the skin......the kindness is not an optional

Reviews.Title: “Love it, so close to everything!!!! And right across from the best diving:)”
Reviews.Author: RozanneWhyte
Reviews.Content: Right next to the beach literallt a few steps out the door to the left and to the right is the main shopping strip. Everything is close. The people are great, the smiles are infectious. We loved the crystal clear diving and Jorge at Scuba Playa across the road made everyday a pleasure:) Thanks for a great stay and we will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: erin b
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the garden loft and it was beautiful. The lush landscape made it easy for us to leave everything behind and soak all the beauty Mexico has to offer. Staff was super friendly and got us great deals on snorkeling and traveling to other tourist attractions close by. The location was the best- right in between the beach and 5th ave (where all the shop and restaurants are located). It was also nice to have10% off at Zenzi and be able to go down to the Beach Club for a day of daiquiris and sun bathing- plus their food is amazing! The best part of Kinbe has to be the pool, the perfect shady spot to lounge when you need a break from the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Sophie S
Reviews.Content: Went travelling with a friend in July 2011. Planned on staying a week in Playa before travelling Mexico for 2 weeks. We had a great stay here, the rooms were small but clean and nice, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms are all set around a garden which gets daily upkeep. Nice roof terrace. No breakfast included, but they offer discounts at beach bars about 5 minutes walk away. The location was perfect, about 50metres from the beach and on the next block to all the bars and clubs and restaurants. There is a great little restaurant right next to the hotel which is cheap, and even though it is near the bars it is very nice. Air conditioning was a plus. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mhenr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Kinbe early this month for 2 nights. It's very nicely decorated with wooden stairs, a lovely pool and a great balcony. There was some noise on the first night from nearby bars / clubs but that's to be expected given the hotel's convenient location. Right near the beach too!! An upgrade to a room with balcony as it was our honeymoon was a very nice touch, especially as we didn't request it.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: sbollo
Reviews.Content: it is a pleasant place to stay at but rooms are quite small or at least ours was small. Do not know how many times hit my head against the tv. Plus but this is a policy other hotels in Mexico adopted and I personally found pretty unfair, you cannot pay the reservation on line before your arrival but are obligated to pay once you get there at the hotel rate which is usually disadvantageous compared to the current rate. Therefore I would suggest to the Kinbe Hotel starting accepting online payments.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: murking
Reviews.Content: It has a unique and great decoration, the pool is beautiful and the location couldn't be better: one block away from the 5ta, and one away from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: saschlueter
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel with great loccation. Staff was friendly, roof top patio and pool nice. We stayed on the Tierra side on the second floor with our own balcony over looking the garden. Would definately return there.

Reviews.Title: “in reply to: "There is a Pattern here... RIP OFF"”
Reviews.Author: SpanishGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Really I was shocked about this comment!! I’ve been at the Kinbé several times in last 2 years and these people seem speaking about another hotel. I’m a traveler and rarely I found anywhere the excellent service provide me by the Kinbe’s staff; the front desk were very personable, friendly, helpful and amusing. They gave plenty of suggestions and tips about everything and all the time these suggestions were correct and overall totally honest. I guess a great staff comes only from a great management; everyone working here was pleasant and helpful, rooms always clean and well maintained. So I can’t understand where these undeserved words come from. Be aware before pass unfair judgments based on your personal issues. I strongly recommend the hotel Kinbé…. And I can't wait to see you on December guys!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique.”
Reviews.Author: JGRToronto
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but great location and very nice staff. Nothing fancy, but nice vibe.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: DoodlePhilip
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant and courteous. The location was a half block from the beach. The room was decent. When it came to check out time though, we were overcharged for the room. The clerk charged us one rate at the hotel, but when we returned home, my credit card statement showed the bill to be higher. I called the hotel to ask why and they didn't have an answer. I wrote the manager an email for an explanation, and I never received a reply. Overall, our trip was amazing, but being taken for more money than promised, left a bad taste in our mouths. Plenty of hotels to choose from in that area and pleasantly surprised to see that there were lots of vacancies, even in July.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect retreat.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisn123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unique, cozy, and just steps from a gorgeous beach and attentive beach bars/restaurants. Michelle at Zenzi is the sweetest hostess on the planet. My heart was heavy when I had to say goodbye to the staff. I'm sure everyone falls in love with Jan and his charm, Alex was a little harder to get close to and what a sweetheart he turned out to be, Andreas is just plain adorable. I hope they know what an important part they played in contributing to a wonderful vacation for me. All the staff there is terrific. On a small sidestreet, but just a few steps from '5th avenue', Kinbe is one of the best locations. I like to get to know a place intimately when I travel, so I'm not into the all-inclusive resorts. This hotel offers a nice place to stay with style and personality. I stayed in a Moody room which is on the 'earth side' nestled in a lush garden with a beautiful path leading to rustic stairs. The description they use is accurate, it has a treehouse feel. Not for people who need to use an elevator. No balcony and not much light in my room, # 7, which is perfect for me. I use my room to rest and sleep, the remainder of my time is spent on the beach or exploring adventures in food, music, salsa dancing, and pathways to more quiet beaches and cenotes! The shower is rough on the feet as it's made with natural stones, something I got used to easily. No shelves in the shower but I used the sink nearby to hold my shampoo, soap, etc. I woke up fairly early as there are some very vocal birds living in those beautful trees. But even that added to the charm and character of the Kinbe hotel. The other side of Kinbe is 'water'. The rooms are more modern and are near the pool and waterfall-type wall. It's very pretty. Staying here added to my adventure in such a wonderful way. It's my first excursion where I was truly traveling alone. I felt safe and comfortable.Part of my heart will be at the Kinbe hotel forever. :)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: carytourist
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Hotel Kinbe. There's a nice garden courtyard. You can get a breakfast buffet on the beach. The staff was friendly and can recommend restaurants for you. The rooms are nice, cozy, and clean. The hotel has a unique personality. It's quiet at night and very convenient to everything. It's just a block off of 5th Avenue and easy walking distance to bus stations and the ferry to Cozumel. If you need a taxi, they're lined up across the street. I highly recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT HOTEL, GOOD PRICE, CLEAN AND WELL LOCATED AT”
Reviews.Author: autosdeeuropa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best option for our honeymoon... In resume: Very clean Nice bedrooms Personal treatment of the owner's. Private for honeymooners Excellent located to bars and 5th avenue attractions. Excellent restaurants for breakfast. Honestly the best option in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: zendiscordia
Reviews.Content: The Kinbe was an amazing hotel and after the ruggedness of the Azucar in Tulum it was nice to check into an upscale trendy spot with all the amenities. The only reason I didn't give this hotel an "excellent" was its check in policy. Throughout our Mexico trip most accommodations were able to work with us if we showed up a bit early ... not the Kinbe... check in is at 3pm (1500) NO EXCEPTIONS ... even at 2:47 we were unable to get our room. So ... great hotel, amazing location ... arrival time ~ plan wisely (though they will hold your luggage in the main area until check in time). .. also, there is no onsite parking .... you pull your car up and unload your bags and then use the pay garage (170 pesos per day) or roll the dice on finding something legal in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: MelaLoaiza
Reviews.Content: Close to the beacj and 5th ave, clean, freat service and contemporary design, even though rooms are small it has all that you need to get back from a long day at the beach or an all night party

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lillonis
Reviews.Content: Pretty boutique hotel convenient to the beach, restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly, the room was clean. We opted for one of the loft rooms which afforded the most privacy and a pretty view of the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place”
Reviews.Author: churchwell
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online not knowing what we would find but were pleasantly surprised. We went for inexpensive/the cheapest room and so the room we were assigned was not all that big and had a view of the garden, which was beautiful. But then I saw that the door to the room next door was open. It was on the third floor and had a balcony. I walked out on to the balcony and the view was breath-taking. This room not only had a balcony, but a spiral staircase up to a second level with a king-size bed. It was available and we were able to upgrade for just a small amount more. The guys at the reception desk were so helpful and friendly I felt like we had made friends for life. The pool isn't big, but quite unique and beautiful. We were a block from the beach and a block form the pedestrian/shopping street. I could not have asked for a better first impression of Playa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Close to beach. Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Alexmc12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Close to beach - 30 seconds walk. Great pool which others look at with envy. Rooms are small and basic, but air con works well and fridge comes in handy. Friendly staff. No restaurant, but many close by

Reviews.Title: “Failure to honor quoted rate”
Reviews.Author: oologah
Reviews.Content: After seeing our room we decided to upgrade to a larger room. We were told one rate for the room we chose, but charged another when we went to check out. I had read in reviews that some of the rooms were small, but they are TINY. We ended up in a loft room (18) with stairs that were unsafe. The tread depth was not consistent or safe, if there were building codes enforced in Playa this room would not have a loft. The room has a television which is difficult to watch downstairs or upstairs. The room furnishings were sparse and simple. After staying at the Kinbe, I can definitely say that the three rooms I saw were over priced compared to the other hotels I have stayed at in Playa over the years. My brother and sister-in-laws were booked up the street one block away and had a larger and better furnished room for about $35 a night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlebunny76
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kinbe is a cute boutique hotel. Well decorated with great ambiance a cool waterfall pool and an upscale swiss family robinson vibe. Location: great, right off 5th avenue, but not too noisy. Walk out the lobby and view the gorgeous ocean. Rooms: a little small with not many places to put your things, but comfy and very cute. Staff: Jan was awesome and really helpful when we came in late at night and tired from getting lost on the way home from Chichen Itza. He also suggested great places to eat and helped us find a place for our rental car until we could return it the next morning. Overall, a really cute chic hotel with great ambiance, location and staff. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dclmoney
Reviews.Content: This place was easy to find taking the bus from Cancun and arriving at the station on Avenida Cinco. It's right off the main street, so maybe a little removed from the nightclub music at night, but a few nights the bass was thumping in the early morning. It was perfectly cute for my girlfriend and I-- small, simply cool designed room, charming garden courtyard and chic pool & waterfall area, and sunny roof area great for reading a book, taking a nap and enjoying views of town and the ocean. It's about two blocks from the beach. The best part were the staff, Andrea and Alejandro, who both alternated shifts and helped make our trip amazing. They were extremely friendly and willing to offer advice on places to eat and things to do, providing us a terrific taxi (Ivan) who we used the whole trip and just who we looked forward to seeing everytime we returned to the boutique hotel from a day of adventure in and around Playa and the Yucatan region.

Reviews.Title: “really relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: pabloManchester
Reviews.Content: Kinbe is lovely, the rooms are good, we had two different rooms on different nights, the ambience is great, ditto the location. The staff are unobtrusive but always around to help. there's great places to eat just nearby, the beach is really close and the pool is such an asset. watch out for grackles bathing at the top of the wall next to the pool and splashing you! We'll make it our stop off point in playa from now on. John and veronica

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Carol_Barreto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well decorated and the staff is very friendly. Another big plus is the location: few minutes from the beach and the main street in Playa del Carmen (5a avenida). There are 2 main areas in the hotel representing water (where the swimming pool is) and earth (the garden, with beautiful plants). Also, the terrace is a great place to spend the end of the afternoon if you are tired. The rooms are very quiet and we had no trouble sleeping; there is a night club tight behind the hotel but we would not have noticed it if we have not walked around the hotel. Our room was a bit small but it doesn’t matter as I believe nobody would spend the day in the room in a place like Playa del Carmen. An additional note, avoid the restaurants in the 5a avenida. Although they are very well decorated, it can be very tourist and overpriced (and the bill always comes wrong – for more, obviously!!). The hotel would give you nice tips for good places to go (and they are not commissioned for that, the tips are truly genuine!!) If I needed to point something negative about the hotel, I would highlight that the prices for the rooms does not include tax of 14% (as most of the businesses in Playa) so when we came to pay the bill the price was higher than what we were expecting initially. I also recommend to do the payment in dollars rather than in Mexican pesos as the exchange rate used by the hotel can be disadvantageous (again, as most of the businesses in Playa).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Mikaelgustafsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Kinbe for our 11 day diving holiday in Playa Del Carmen. Apart for some minor situation with the toilet not flushing (taken care of immediately)we had no problems whatsoever. The staff are nice and helped us with whatever questions we had. The nearby night club played music quite loud, but it was nothing too serious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern flare in a great location”
Reviews.Author: drumpoint2003
Reviews.Content: This is a nice safe hotel right in the middle of the action of downtown playa. The building is quiet and you check in at the front desk every time in and out. This is great because one does not need carry the key anywhere and the Kinbe staff can keep track of who is in building. The staff are friendly and helpful. Although, it would have been nice have had someone give us a list of good tour operators. There is one right across the street they use and we did not even know it.

Reviews.Title: “great place - great location!”
Reviews.Author: tportela74
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff - remember you every time. clean hotel, great spot - very close to beach. will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: kebrews
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day stay, the hotel and staff were great! Garden room was small but staff kept it and property spotless. Jan and the other desk staff were friendly, helpful and concerned about a medical issue I was experiencing. Hotel is very accessible to 5th Avenue and the beach. We will definetly stay there again. Other reviews noted noise from 5th Avenue, we heard none and we were there over a weekend. We were very sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Kinbe was a lot of fun.”
Reviews.Author: DavidA51
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Kinbe is perfect. Really nice people who speak many languages well, are very friendly and helpful. My room was small but sweet and had everything I needed. The roof terrace is a nice in the morning to read and have coffee or take a glass of wine in the evening. 1/2 block to the beach. The atmosphere is sort of mod-tropical-Italian-chic. A charming and satisfying stay. Thanks Elena and Jan.

Reviews.Title: “beware - reservations not honored”
Reviews.Author: Hendrika9
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy with my 'almost' stay at this hotel. We had revervations since October. We got there early morning from Cozumel. They said the room was not ready yet, and offered to hold our lugguge while we went out for the day. We returned about 4PM and they told us they overbooked and did not have a room for us at all! I can't believe that they stored our bags and suddenly the room that was not ready was now not available at all. This is really poor business! After we complained, they offered us a single room with one bed. As mature women who reserved a room with two double beds, we could not accept this. They offered to find another hotel for us only after we said that this was not acceptable. They found a room at a very old, old hotel nearby. It was so very noisy. We tried two rooms there and could not find quiet. We had no choice but to stay at the alternate hotel. I will never trust a reservation at the Kinbe.again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is awesome, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Kletka
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to Kinbe, the clerk at the reception desk made us face the fact that in the middle of our stay we would get an upgrade (free of charge) and will have to change the room. It is never fun for me to pack and unpack things, but to do it on vacation seemed totally nightmarish. Still, we decided to be nice and agreed. Here I should warn you: never agree for an upgrade especially if your stay is short, even if they promise to move you to their best room. There is no guarantee that you will get the room you were initially offered (it actually happened to us, although I don't complain as the room they finally placed us to was nice and pretty), but the most important thing - you will be "roomless" for about a half of the day. They asked us to move out before 12 PM and put our things next to their reception desk and let us move in after 3 PM. We had no place even to change our clothes after the beach. Not the best situation for people on vacations!!! Our first room was very small but nice. It was overlooking their luscious and very beautiful garden. The only thing which bothered me there was the dampness of the room's air, and as a consequence, of our bedlinen and clothing. You will never have a chance to get your towels and swimsuits dry there. The second room boasted awesome private balcony with lovely view. I liked it very much. But... There was no hot water in the shower. We informed receptionist about the problem and he promised us to take care of that. However, the next day we were forced to take cold shower again. I don't think it is appropriate for the self-respecting hotel to have it's guest to freeze under the cold water. Unfortunately, the problem was never fixed. I cannot complain about the noise. We did not hear anything during the night. The hotel's location is great, it is close to everything. So, as you can see, I have quite mixed impressions of this hotel. I has some advantages and downsides. I would probably recommend this place to others but mainly due to it's location and nice outlook. The service, however, requires significant improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location and service”
Reviews.Author: akataylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Playa del Carmen with my Girlfriend and travelled with 2 of my best friends, stayed a week in Playa from the 4th til the 11th. Very close to beach, 5th ave strip of shops, nightclub district. Charming hotel with great feel to it and nice big rooms and good facilities (my friends and I stayed in the mini-suite rooms), views of the beach and large balconies too. Very helpful when my girlfriend became sick, organised a doctor for us and even posted our postcards for us because the post office was far away! Always remembered which room we were staying in as we came and left the hotel. It got a little loud at night sometimes, but that's to be expected with our windows open near the main street. Really great stay here, our favourite of our whole Mexican trip. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to the main street and close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: bickbea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new section which is considerable better than the "garden" section - which rooms were very small and dark. We had booked and wanted to be on the ground floor as my hasband is handicapped. After much discussion we received a room in the new section for a higher price of course - there is no handicap access to this hotel - three stairs off the street level - we managed although the reception clerk was not very helpful. Other than the reception clerk and the manager, the other staff was very helpful. The room was large and well maintained. The best thing about this hotel was it's location - half block to the beach and half block to the main avenue "5th". Security was good at the hotel with 24 hr. staff on.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Its all about location”
Reviews.Author: akoti
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel in the middle of all the action. The pretty room is small, so it can be tight, we managed since we were not there to sit in our room. Starbucks is down the block, plenty of street parking, beautiful gym is 2 blocks away that is only $5 day pass with hotel discount (offers yoga 4x per day). Beach is 50 yrds away with 10% hotel discount to the beach club ($20 for 2 chairs and umbrella $45 for 1hr couples massage) which you can pay or just spend that amount for lunch and chairs are free. I would not eat on 5th ave as prices are comparable to NYC for subpar food. Go to 10th ave or side streets for better food and great little bar on the corner of 5th and and a martini bar around the corner toward the beach which is always packed. We did bring ear plugs just incase based on reviews and we did hear some music Sat night, but otherwise it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “swiss family robinson type hotel close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: danabulous
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Kinbe for four nights out of my five night stay in Playa del Carmen. It was my first time to this part of Mexico and I wanted to do Playa and not Cancun to avoid the huge resorts and tourist traps. PDC is still touristy, but smaller and fun. The hotel is literally 1 block from the beach. It has a nice lobby and open in the middle (motel style) with a jungle type garden. It was beautiful. We were greeted by the owner who spoke perfect english and was very excited to have us there. Our room was on the small side, but personally, I don't spend a lot of time in hotel rooms on holiday. The air conditioning worked and we had big windows open to the jungle garden on the second floor. The bathroom was rustic with spanish tile but updated amenities. There was also a small pool with a giant fountain wall, which was nice after a long day on a hot sandy beach. One night we grab some beers from our room and sat up on the roof deck, you can hear to ocean and the other PDC night sounds. Most people like resorts because they have deals where you sit on their part of the beach. However, the block that Hotel Kinbe is on has a restaurant right down the street on the beach. I think it started with a "Z" but it was great. We could sit there all day, order beers, food and without much hassle. They also had umbrellas, which you will need because the sun is intense. It was a great hotel and the price cannot be beat esp. if you're on a budget! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice decor but...”
Reviews.Author: NickMtl
Reviews.Content: 2 comments about the hotel: -Wireless internet is only available in some areas (eg.: reception). It didn't work in our room. -While the hotel advertises its rates in US$, payment will be made in pesos. Also, during check in, the front desk staff indicated the conversion rate would be 12 pesos = US$1, we ended getting 13 pesos = US$1. The official exchange rate barely changed in the meantime so that was disappointing and made a substantial difference.

Reviews.Title: “great location trendy look”
Reviews.Author: fradrip
Reviews.Content: love this place the best of all in playa. great lobby and very very helpful staff. location was dead smack in the center and i would return in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Gavontheweb
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very helpful with all our needs. However I would warn against going to Playa del Carmen if you want something quieter. To be fair we should have read more about the town but we were just passing through and much preferred quiet Tulum down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good short stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHampton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kinbe Hotel in April 2010 for 5 days, I was attending my Niece's wedding. My room was on the first floor accessed through a garden and up some stairs (Not ideal for invalid or wheelchair customers) I was a little dubious when I arrived late evening in the pouring rain as it was my first time in Mexico, the receptionist was friendly, efficient and informative and upon reaching my room my initial fears were dismissed. The room was average size, large bed,everything working (inc. efficient wi-fi) and quite comfortable. Bathroom was small but nicely designed with shower only and very clean, the lack of a bath tub was no concern to me. The hotel is approx. 75m from the beach and similar distance to 5th Avenue which is the main shopping street and centre of all activities daytime and night time in Playa Del Carmen. Taxi ranks are very close and the bus station is a 5-10 minute walk down 5th. Avenue. With the beach and nightlife being so close I can understand concerns about noise but I never encountered problems of this nature. I was pleased with my choice for this short stay although I thought the price was high, it was my first experience of a Mexican holiday resort so I have no previous knowledge of hotel prices in this country. I would use Hotel Kinbe again without hesitation but it is not ideal for a lengthy stay in this busy but very pleasant resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location, close to the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Nate_0978
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay right off 5th, and don't mind a little late night music from the beach parties, then this is a steal. Our room was nice and clean, the staff were cool, and you can't beat the location. Great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pinstripesdumbo
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It's off the main street, but not too close to the craziness. It also is right next to the beach, so my boyfriend and I would walk right out of the hotel and be at the beach in two minutes. The staff was super nice and were very accomadting to us. The rooms were smaller than I thought it would be, but there was a huge bed in the room. Plus, we were out on the beach or doing tours all day that we didn't have an issue with it at all. I will say that we could hear the parties from the beach and on 5th avenue at night; however, you should expect the noise if you're staying off the main street. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: I&P-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kinbe seven years ago and liked it very much, so I was looking forward to return for two nights. The staff was partially the same and friendly. We stayed at the new part (room 28 Rugiada). Very trendy and nice. Wifi was good as well. One big con is how noisy the new part is. They have a kind of metal layer on the stairs and if you walk on them, it makes a lot of noise. Most people come to party in Playa and will come home late during the night. We woke up because of that and because they started to play music in their room at 4 am. I asked them to be more silent, which had no effect. Then the guard came. That had effect until he left. Very childish. I used earplugs, but that would not help enough. Can't blame Kinbe for their guests, but it was too bad that the people were so selfish. Was glad I did not have to go diving the next morning, as I would have been very tired. I am not sure whether I would stay here again because of the bad isolation. Location is great in Playa. I was quite shocked how much Playa has changed in the last years in a bad way. It is turning/already turned into a new Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern design and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: croydondweller
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at Kinbe for the last week of a 3-week trip around Mexico, booked on the internet. Playa del Carmen is not as big as it first appears and the hotel is just off 5th Avenue (the main street for shopping and eating) and just minutes from the lovely beach. It's also walking distance from the bus station as long as you don't have too much luggage. Design is a combination of traditional stucco, with modern touches on a clean background, at least the rooms around the swimming pool, but there are also 'garden' rooms overlooking a lush, green, shaded area, which are not quite so modern - make sure you know which you're getting. The modern rooms all have flat screen TVs, aircon, balconies and bathrooms with huge walk-in showers. Swimming pool is on the cool side, but prob perfect in the heat of the summer and the roof terraces offer splendid views over both ocean and town. The hotel is owned by Italians, some of the staff are Italian, some Mexican, but all are very helpful and will advise on restaurants, shopping and help to arrange trips, if you're interested. Most of the hotels in Playa don't offer breakfast, but there is no shortage of places to eat on 5th Avenue. The only negative for us was the nightclubs located a block down from the hotel; a couple of nights the music was really pounding and woke us up during the night, but Playa is a party town, so you can't really complain! Also, the wifi is patchy at best, but you're not there to surf the internet are you? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: packan13
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at the Kinbe for one week and it was awesome! They gave us a free upgrade to their best room upon arriving. We had a king size bed, a walk in shower and a balcony overlooking the indoor pool. The room was spotless and the customer service was excellent. Although the hotel is just around the corner from the busy 5th Ave and the beach (and beach clubs) our room was super quiet. I will definitely book this hotel again for my next Playa trip, I highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: RoaryCat
Reviews.Content: less than a half block off of the midway point of 5th Avenue and 500 meters to the beach, the location of Hotel Kinbe could not be better. Very good service, beautiful grounds on the right side of the hotel, Tierra Kaab (lush rain forest like area, where our room was - my wife said it was like a treehouse!) and the left side, Agua Ha had the pool, waterfall and had a more trendy vibe. The room we had ("Pretty") was small but we spent very little time there nayway and didn't even think about turning on the TV - why would we?? The room was simply decorated, tile floors, and came with a mini fridge and safe. The bathroom was small but nice - good water pressure and hot water from the shower. Wireless access was spotty but more of the time I was able to get on with my iPad. All of this for only $45 + tax per night! One thing - not an issue for us but maybe for some is that you leave your room key with the front desk every time you leave. I didn't care but some might.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emperience...”
Reviews.Author: travelandunravel
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Kinbe was mixed. In some aspects, it was wonderful-beautiful space, interesting room, very friendly staff. However, our room was quite dark, didn't have enough natural or artificial light and the bathroom shower was made from large pebbles-VERY UNCOMFORTABLE. I loved the hotel roof deck-but didn't know they had one until my third day in. I discovered it on my own. I also wasn't told about the deal with Wicky's beach club-I learned about it after reading reviews here-we hiked down to the Kool Klub on 26th North (FANTASTIC!) I would recommend Kinbe with caution-I did find the hotel EXTREMELY quiet, the staff very friendly, the rooms clean BUT in serious need of a functional makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother to look any further...pick Kinbe!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchgirl1
Reviews.Content: Kinbe is a very cute and stylish boutique hotel.The Location couldn't be any better!!!The (beautiful!) beach is a 1 minute walk and so are the shops on 5th avenue.Literally...1 minute!The nightlife is just around the corner, but when you decide to have an early sleep you won't hear the noise at all! The staff is very friendly and the rooms are cosy and super clean! I travel around the world a lot...but really fell in love with Playa del Carmen.Will definitely stay again at Kinbe!

Reviews.Title: “cute, clean, friendly and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rebecca063
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Playa Del Carmen for a week and decided to stay at Kinbe, as the pictures on line were so trendy and fun. We took a $9 bus ride into playa from the airport and walked to our hotel within 7 min. The hotel is adorable. The rooms are small, with basic needs met (my room had a dbl bed, small expensive mini bar and cute basic bathroom and an adorable small wardrobe) and linens were nice and colourful... over all very cute and artsy. The gardens are tropical and really pretty and pool area small but quaint. The hotel has a cool top deck were you can sun tan or just hang out...nice area to enjoy a cold beer! Staff were incredible, especially 'Limbert' he worked night shifts, so helpful, professional and welcoming! The hotel is located right in the heart of EVERYTHING... (everything is all from 1-10min walking distance ) beach 1 min walk, high and low end restaurants, star bucks, really good ice-cream parlours, low and high end shopping and you can walk on the main strip/streets at all times of the night, as there is security everywhere for tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Haven in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Thaproban
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and cosy, specially the staff were very caring and friendly. The rooms had real character, comfortable. The food was good and we ate from the hotel most of our meals. Overall it was a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: chris_ax76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kinbe for the first 6 days of our summer holiday in Mexico in July 2010. After some online research for a mid-range, conveniently located hotel in Playa del Carmen, we decided Kinbe was the best fit for us - and it did not disappoint! Apart from one evening when the water supply to the hotel was temporarily halted (during which the hotel staff were very helpful and informative), the stay went without any problems whatsoever. The rooms are basic, but cosy & clean. Everything you need is on-hand and you only need to ask the super-helpful and friendly staff for anything else. You are located just a 2 minute walk from the lovely beach and less than a minute from the busy 5th Avenue - close enough to be convenient, yet far enough away to feel relaxed. The air conditioning unit in the room was a bit noisy, but completely effective. Take some earplugs if you are a light sleeper (worked just fine for me)! Overall, Kinbe exceeded expectation and we would definitely go back. The Staff were undoubtedly the highlight for us!

Reviews.Title: “Kinbe! Best boutique hotel in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonBr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went to Playa for our 1 year wedding anniversary. We have stayed at several of the boutique hotels in town, and this has been our favorite!!! Kinbe is beautifully maintained, and the rooms are small but comfortable, always clean, and simply yet sophisticatedly decorated. Our friends rented room #6 (with the big patio), which we took advantage of each evening. Our room was on the other side of the hotel facing the pool, and although it was smaller, it had a cute balcony and was very quiet. The staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly (shout out to Victor)! On top of all of its great qualities, it is surprisingly very affordable! Almost forgot, the location is definitely worth mentioning - approx. 1.5 blocks from beach, and 1 block from 5th. Super convenient to both, but not so close to where it is noisy. Over all great value!

Reviews.Title: “a tiny oasis”
Reviews.Author: tiny13
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. It was clean, stylish, and only steps from the beach. The rooms were a little small but seriously who cares? The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous gem. Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: khnelson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for just one night on a great last minute deal through expedia, and was not sure what to expect. I only wish we could have stayed longer. The staff is friendly, the location is great, rooms are fantastic, and the beds are soooo comfy! Also, the neighboring restaurant is really good. The ceviche is awesome and hugely portioned, and prices are MUCH better than on 5th ave. There is a rooftop deck where you can lounge at night with a beer. My husband's comment was "this is my favorite hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere."

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Kinbe”
Reviews.Author: deeboochi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came from Cancun where we had a miserable hotel experience the night before, so when we arrived at Kinbe it was like a dream. The location is amazing. It's right of 5th and about half a block from the sand- where you can lounge on beach chairs at Wickey's for only 100 pesos. The design of the hotel is stunning with a sleek modern lobby and an open indoor pool. The hotel is divided into two sections half being very modern while the other half is like staying in a tree house- VERY COOL. Most importantly, the service was outstanding. Everyone at the hotel was incredibly accommodating and helpful. I always felt safe and didn't even question leaving valuables out of the safe. I think it speaks volumes. I would stay at Kinbe again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a second home.”
Reviews.Author: dskdskdsk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Kinbe twice this year, for a total of 3 weeks, and every day was a joy! The staff is hip and interesting, and make every trip past the desk a pleasure in itself. It's a block from the best clubs in Playa, less than a block from the beach, and a few feet from the main strip. And by feet, I am being literal--I didn't wear shoes the whole time I was in Playa. The rooms are thoughtfully designed, and offer the creature comforts you'd expect from boutique hotels elsewhere in the world. The 'Mellow' and 'Garden' suites are small, practical, euro-style rooms, ideal for the young traveler on a budget. Personally, I prefer the detail-oriented Rugiada, mostly for its aesthetic appeal: minimal white rooms, with white sheets, white towels, and accented with a touch of red. The Rugiada rooms also include a balcony overlooking the pool and courtyard--great for loafing and reading a book or drinking a beer. If you're taking "that special someone" to Playa, definitely pay the extra for The Rugiada, you will not regret it. I've stayed at 4 other hotels in Playa and this has definitely been my favorite. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kinbe, Playa Del Carmen, Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTravelista
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kinbe is a small, but quaint place in Playa Del Carmen. The bathrooms are little tight, so you have to take turns using the facility, but its close proximity to the beach made the difference. Its clean with a cute little garden buffering the interior. It is centrally located to 5th Avenue which has everything you need including restaurants, sports bars and clubs and of course SHOPPING. There is a scuba shop right across the street and a Starbucks kiddie corner to the property. The night life is vibrant with beachfront clubs within walking distance. NOTE: Because of the pedestrian traffic on 5th Avenue your transport van from the airport will not be able to drop you off in front of your hotel, you will have to walk a couple blocks with your luggage. So if you pack heavy, stay at a resort outside of Playa.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jayjay12
Reviews.Content: Kinbe is a beautiful hotel located in the heart of Playa del Carmen. My husband and I went back and forth between staying at an all inclusive oceanfront resort or staying on 5th avenue and enjoying the different cuisines and night life that downtown offers. We decided on Kinbe, which is a few steps from the beach and from the shops, restaurants and bars. We got to spend A LOT of time in our room because it rained three days out of the five that we were there and we loved every bit of it. Starbucks is accross the street. The room was comfortable and clean. The pool is beautiful and quiet. And the roof top has lounge chairs and a nice ocean view. Last but not least, the staff is incredible! Especially Andreo and Fernanda. They can get the best deals on tours and know the best restaurants in town. They made us feel at home. Thank you very much guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Damber
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. We had a room on the third floor which was a little trouble because the stairs are narrow and there is no elevator so it was some work getting our luggage up and down. Also the room we had was quite small but it didn't bother us because we were only staying one night. If you are staying 3 nights or more you may want to get a suite which would have more room. The location is great, very close the beach and 5th ave. Staff was nice and helpful. We were only there one night but would stay here again if we wanted to be in downtown playa.

Reviews.Title: “a nice getaway, thank you kinbe”
Reviews.Author: theguyintheroom
Reviews.Content: we arrived rather late, 9pm on a friday night, but had no problem or hassles with our existing reservation being there ready for us, all was in good order and taken care of by Andreo at the front desk, the room was quite small but had a airy feeling with the tall ceilings and light color paint. very modern fixtures in the bath! the lock/security on the doors seems a little flimsy but a room safe is provided for your valuables. housekeeping did a great job with fresh linens and keeping the sand we tracked into the room swept up. thank you girls. enjoy the chocolates we left for you! one thing that was a minus was the noisy stairs, they are coated with a thin piece of steel and it amplifies every step anyone takes on them, expect this noise if you are on the poolside. the roof deck is very comfortable and a nice sunrise view or a lunch spot. the new wal mart is a few blocks up the road and buying beers, lunch snacks or anything else is made easy with that. safe, central, stylish, great wifi and comfortable beds. a really great place, the association with wicky beach club was nice but got a little loud in the late afternoon so we just moved down closer to the water with our towels and found the sun just as nice, but quieter!

Reviews.Title: “Super chic, super convenient location. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shawny_pooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kinbe for 4 nights. We had a room that opened up to the pool area. It was lovely. The decor was minimal but super chic. The bed was comfy and for once in our traveling experiences we spent alot of time in our room. TV was available in english and we spent quite a bit of time enjoying the room and its amentities. The only complaint was that the rooms next to teh pool have a satir well that is lined with metal...it looks super cook, but can be a bit loud. the first night we did have some trouble with noise, but I believe it was mainly due to a huge party happening on avenida 5 (we were there during spring break). Otherwise the rest of our nights we enjoyed wondderful sleep with no problems (even from the stairwell noise) . I wouldn't even consider it an issue, but wanted to give a completely honest review. The hotel was right aross the street from the dive shop we chose, a short walk from the beach and Avenida 5. Truly the best location I could image for a visit to Playa. The staff was great and friendly, even with our frequent comings and goings from the room. In sum, it was a great stay and we will definitely be back to Playa and the Kinbe!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and chic at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: eurojamie04
Reviews.Content: We debated between Kinbe and the minimalist Mexican kitch hotel - Basico - just a block away on Quinta Avenia. But I'm glad we chose Kinbe. We stayed here for 8 days during our visit to Playa. Our room was minimally yet thoughtfully decorated. At about $79 USD a night, we definitely got what we paid for. It was cleaned daily, felt incredibly safe. The 30-something hipster staff was friendly and hospitable. The pool is beautiful and relaxing to sit next to in the afternoons. The laundry service is quick and cheap, and I've never seen my clothes so white. The restaurant next door serves tasty ceviche and 2x1 drinks. There's a Wal-mart less than four blocks away to pick up drinks and snacks, and there's a mini-fridge back in the room to put things in. My favorite nearby beach spot was Fuzion, a restaurant/bar a few blocks away with live Reggae at 5, great food and helpful service. They're a perfect mix - ah hem, fusion - of elegance and beach casual.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and the bare minimum for the room itself”
Reviews.Author: tmimi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right off of 5th Ave and a very close walk to the beach. It has a white front which looks like it's been newly renovated and when you walk though the small hotel it has lush greenery. The room was a bit of a surprise since when you open the door you basically run into the bed. It's the size of a closet. Which is fine since it wasn't too expensive and we weren't planning on staying in our room much anyways. The one thing I do wish they provided was bottled water. You'll have to get some from one of the many mini marts on 5th ave. It's very pretty with a rooftop deck and a waterfall going down one of the sides of the building. It was quiet at night and close enough to everything you'd want to be near.

Reviews.Title: “Not cool, Kinbe - give it to me straight”
Reviews.Author: HI_via_NYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at Kinbe last night and we were both pretty disappointed with our experience for 2 big reasons. 1. I did not appreciate being nickled-and-dimed: When I booked our room on Kinbe's website they quoted me a price that included tax in USD. I entered all my credit card information online and received a receipt via email for the charge. Upon arriving, however, I learned that entering my credit card information just reserved a room but did not pay for one, and we were asked to pay for the room at that point. That seemed fine to me but this is where Kinbe gets sly and unless you're paying attention you won't even notice. I gave them my credit card to pay for the room and they gave me a total price in pesos since they apparently have to charge my card in pesos (?, whatever - fine). What really pissed me off is that they used an exchange rate that was obviously higher than the day's exchange rate so my credit card bill in USD is actually higher that what was quoted online. Depending on the day's exchange rate, this could be a difference of $2 to $10 USD per day per room. You can pay what they actually quote you online in USD if you have cash, but who wants to carry around hundreds of dollars of cash in Mexico (or anywhere, for that matter) - that's why I booked and paid online! Not cool, Kinbe - you should know better. 2. The room was way overpriced compared to hotels in playa and neighboring areas. For example, my wife and I stayed in two 4-star resorts in Cozumel and Cancun that were cheaper and worlds nicer than our small, modest room at Kinbe. Yes, Kinbe is definitely charming and has character, but for what they're charging compared to other hotels, I'm sorry, I just thought we would get way more. I would absolutely not recommend this hotel unless they were much more honest and up front about their rates (no nickle-and-diming), and unless they dropped their prices by at least 33%.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: USgovt-traveler
Reviews.Content: Kinbe Hotel is small hotel in the middle of Playa del Carmen's tourist area. We arranged for the airport transfer by email with the hotel. The four of us were picked up right outside of the airport by the driver holding a sign with our name. It took less than 40 mins to get to the hotel. Hotel checkin was quick and the hotel stored our bags because our room was not ready when we checked at 12:30pm. We stayed in a Moody room that was clean and included a king bed with a small table and refrig. The bathroom was small but adequate. This room is basic, no frills rooms for those who do not plan on spending a lot of time in the room. The desk staff were great and helped us with directions and booking a tour of Chizen itza for $40. They also gave us an extra pillow on request. The beach is less than a block away and the front desk provides towels and a pass to the Wicky beach club. We spend 2 days sitting in the sun, drinking and eating. If you have a crave for a hamburger this is the recommended place (some people gotta have one). Check out was quick with no problems. This is a great hotel if your looking for just a nice room and no more. There is no lobby area, no hotel bar/restaurant and is not on the beach. BUT with the great location, you can have a variety of fun places to drink a beer, partake in awesome food and shop all day long. We returned to the hotel several times a day to drop off purchases, change clothes or use the bathroom without wasting cab fare. ME-I travel more than 30 days away from home a year for work and spend a lot of time in hotels and airports around the US.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends love Kinbe!!”
Reviews.Author: dmdevl
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I went to Playa for a getaway from our busy, winter lives. We wanted a reasonably priced hotel, comfortable for the three of us and located close to the beach. We got all three in Kinbe! The location of Kinbe is PERFECT!!! A half a block from the action packed 5th Avenue and a half a block from the beach. We were a little worried about the three of us fitting into the Junior Suite when we first walked in, but we put the futon up and staked out places for our bags. We could have had more room if we had been willing to carry bags up the circular stairway to the king bed loft. Because of the loft and the peaked roof, the room has more of a vertical feel than horizontal. It was nice to sit on the balcony and look at the ocean while getting ready. The air worked fine and the king bed was very comfortable. The futon was like a futon. I think maybe it would be better to use a day bed that would actually function as a couch when not in use and be off the floor with a nicer mattress when used as a bed. We liked the grounds of the hotel and the folks at the front desk were very personable. We liked the beach club that the hotel is affiliated with - Wicky's. We would stay there again. Tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “A Sea of Tranquility!”
Reviews.Author: 4th-dimension
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with the staff, cleanliness, comfortable beds, and atmosphere that when we come back to Playa del Carmen we will definitely be staying at the Kinbe! We stayed in a Garden Suite that has a large patio that overlooked the avenue to the beach. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, pleasant and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: belita58
Reviews.Content: The location here is great! We were right off of Avenida Quinta where all the action is, and a block from the beach, which was visible from the lobby and apparently from some third floor rooms. In spite of its close proximity to the bars, shops and restaurants, it was quiet and we had no trouble sleeping. There is a nice low-key cafe next door, tasty and inexpensive, and a super dive shop called Geofish one block down towards the beach, Our teenagers dove for the first time and loved it. The hotel staff were great. We had a late bus out and they let us stash our luggage in the back while we went ziplining.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy haven just off the main drag"”
Reviews.Author: davenewton11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently , stylish clean botique rooms. Had the cheapest room "Pretty" very comfortable. This place has an amazing roof terrace for everyone to useand is a stones throw from the beach and 5th avenue. Had trouble finding it just walk up 5th avenue to calle 10 then turn left towards the sea, may be the hotel should put a map on the web site ( suggestion). Had a minor issue checking out the guy didn't seem to know what was going on ( partly due to my poor spanish)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, decent ("Moody") room”
Reviews.Author: Haarlem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov09 in a ground floor "Moody" room (room #1, behind reception). Very centrally located on Cally 10, just off the main Avenida 5. The bottom floor also ensured no noise was coming through, though with little day light. Room was large and clean. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast options plentiful. Great dive shop Scuba Playa located opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 28days
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kinbe is great. If you're after something a little more tasteful and personal than the massive beachfront resort, this is perfect. We had a great view of the beach and the rooms were lovely. Location is perfect, right in the middle of playa and only 15m to the beach. You are given vouchers for one of the beach front bars so there is no problem finding a sunbed on the sand, and the staff could not be more helpful. Only thing we could fault them on is the value of breakfast. You get a voucher for a restaurant up the road as there is no restaurant on site, and this only covers a basic continental breakfast. We ended up paying an additional 80pesos each morning so we could have the buffet instead. It's definitely not worth paying extra to have breakfast included unless you're happy with cereal and toast. Kinbe is a really beautiful place to stay, and looks a lot more expensive than it is.Definitely excellent value and I would stay there again in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & location"”
Reviews.Author: mexico4ever2009
Reviews.Content: The Kinbé is a boutique hotel with the best location ever: one block from the 5th Avenue and even less from the beach. Our room was chic, wide and very bright. We felt sleep every night with the sound of the waterfall in a fantastic king size bed. We loved the rooftop terrace and the lush tropical garden. The staff is amazing very helpful; thanks Alexis and Raul!! They kindly gave us the best tips for restaurants, tours and much more. Thanks to the cleaning ladies, they really make us feel home. Elena, the sales manager, who made our reservation was very kind and clear, thanks to be so patience and intelligent. We are travelers and we recognize a good and professional hotel management; We met once the general manager at the desk and we didn’t have the opportunity To tell her how much we enjoyed our stay, thank you Stefania. We strongly recommend the Kinbe’.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cipresso
Reviews.Content: My boy friend and I spent a couple of weeks in this small charming hotel very very close to the beach, only 50Mt. We were looking for a relaxing place in the centre of Playa Del Carmen, Hotel Kimbe was absolutely the best compromise we could find. Room are very tidy. Staff is friendly and helpful. They organized for us wonderful daily trips and they help us in all we wanted to have. We are already planning to go there another week, maybe during March next year. We strongly recommended Hotel Kimbe'.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay if you are not into frills”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNik
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect and met it's purpose for my friend and I. The rooms were small but clean, but that is all we really needed, considering we spent all our time on the beach. The beach was about a 2 minute walk away from the hotel. We went to the beach all day and were allowed to use the beach umbrellas and chairs of one of the beach front hotels. The staff was very nice and informative. They were able to answer a lot of our questions regarding places to eat and sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haploke
Reviews.Content: Nice trendy hotel. Rooms are not as spacious as I would like to have seen, but certainly enough for my needs. On saturday the outdoor nightlife sounds were able to creep into the room. The staff is really incredible and back over backwards to satisfy the needs of the customers. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “A true Italian rip off in Mexico. A nightmare!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WilitaMadrid
Reviews.Content: Looks nice from the outside but when you try to spend a night there you discover a nightmare. Super noisy during night and day!!! in the night due to the night clubs with loud music until 6:00 am; Mornings at 8:00 started the construction of a building next to the hotel!!! We booked an room that was more expensive because it had views to the see. THERE WAS NO WAY TO SEE THE SEA!! Only from a little corner in a corridor outside our room and the sea was far away!! We could not rest for the whole week and we were stuck there because it was high season. The owners of the hotel the worst, very unfriendly and unpolite. They also tried to rip us off with the credit card and the Exchange Rate. My worst experience in a hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Kinbe....Perfect Location in Playa”
Reviews.Author: pdcmx09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Playa del Carmen. We loved the Kinbe. The staff has been wonderful since we emailed them a year ago to book the room. They were extremely nice and helpful once we arrived. We stayed in the Moody room/ partial ocean view and loved it. It was quite small but was just what we were looking for. We were not wanting to stay in a big resort....we went to Playa del Carmen to chill in laid back mode and the Kinbe was the perfect hotel for that. It was in walking distance to every place we wanted to go, just seconds from 5th avenue and a couple minutes walk to the ferry to Cozumel. We are planning another trip to Playa in the near future and plan on staying at the Kinbe again. No complaints about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “yeah nah!”
Reviews.Author: lililuv
