Reviews.Content: hmmm im V open minded but feel this hotel is over rated. i dont mind carrying my own bags up 2 flights or no tea & coffee,could even cope with the smaller than expected roon (thank goodness for the balcony) BUT the room was very very MUSTY, & theres no way ur swinging anything in the bathroom let alone a cat... great pool,great gardens,great decore. V V average staff.fantastic location! looks good but the reality...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Palma27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Kinbe. We stayed in the Rugiada King room on the top floor. Was the perfect size for the 2 of us. Bathroom was also a good size with a large shower. No complaints about the housekeeping, always cleaned well. No bugs or mosquitos. One night we had a little gecko sleepover and he was gone the next day. Was just a few steps to 5th Ave and to the beach! Staff were all very friendly and helpful. We loved it and would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Middling hotel - definitely not enough bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: tylerette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kinbe from April 17-21 2009. I chose the Garden room (Kinbe offers 4 types), which was a terrible mistake. I understand that this type of room was meant to mimic the rustic, natural feel of a jungle palapa, but our room had ants, flies, and mosquitos. The downstairs half of the Garden room (the living area) is also very tiny - tinier than expected. After two nights in the Garden room, we told the front desk we needed a new room. Unfortunately, the hotel's only availability was in their most expensive room (Rugiada), but at that point we desperately needed a bug-free room, so we said yes. The Rugiada room was much better - bug free, great, spacious shower, and large room overall. My one point of contention here is that even though the only reason we switched rooms was due to a fault of the hotel's (bug problem), the front desk did not volunteer to comp our remaining two nights at the original Garden room price. The difference was only $20 USD, so yes, it's not a large amount, but I hate to say it - it's the principle of the matter. In any case though, to the hotel's credit, the front desk staff were incredibly polite, efficient, and understanding. Overall, I would not stay at Kinbe again. Even though the location is great (right on 5th, and steps away from Zenzi Bar, which is one of the best beach bars in Playa), the prices are too high for what you are getting. Don't be fooled by the lovely lobby - yes, it's nicely appointed, but that's just the lobby. That's not your room. You are better off paying a bit more and going with Blue Parrot or Mosquito Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and groovy little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: estrella-bella
Reviews.Content: This is a hip little place that doesn't claim a lot of bells and whistles. It is clean, near the beach and all of the action. It is easy to find and feels safe. My only complaint is that they have 2 double beds in some of the rooms but only will book 3 people to a room. I don't know if it is to discourage families or what. You can call toll free from the states and can speak to someone in English. That is a bonus that most boutique hotels in this price range do not offer. The cleaning staff was dressed beautifully and seemed very respectful of your space. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel at a perfect location, with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: my_name_is_FERRY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Kinbé hotel when we first arrived at Playa del Carmen. Being such a nice hotel at a perfect location (only 50 meters from the beach and a few steps from 5th ave), we decided to spend our last three nights in Mexico here.( After travelling to Tulum and Cozumel) The staff is very friendly, the rooms are nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SFtravellers09
Reviews.Content: The hotel had very friendly and helpful staff. They were accommodating despite our last minute reservations. We stayed in two different rooms, and both were very clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated. The location was great; on a block halfway between the main shopping avenue and the beach. There were numerous great restaurants and bars located within 2 blocks of the hotel. My only caution would be regarding the stairs to our loft bed. They were unevenly spaced, and it made concentration absolutely necessary when climbing and descending.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: donotgrl
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler with a branded hotel preference, I was skeptical. Kinbe Hotel lived up to all of it's promises. Fantastic location, close to the beach, tons of restaurants, shopping and the ferry. Although the rooms are small, they are clean and charming. The courtyard is a tropical gem, and the staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgable...no language barrier here! You can tell that everyone takes pride in their hotel and wants to make sure you enjoy your stay. I'm already planning a trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place - Space and Service”
Reviews.Author: miss208
Reviews.Content: I need to thank all the staff at the Kinbe once again. This was my 4th visit to the beautiful village of Playa....each time I always stay at the Kinbe for me I travel with friends all of which have different financial means - we all stay were we want and can afford. So as a single woman I just love the Kinbe - close to all the best places in town. Around the clock front desk personal available - safe - truly comfortable & clean rooms. I have stayed in 4 different rooms each offering something different.... The garden rooms - are shady and lazy with comfortable sofas - tv's you lose track of time. My most recent favorite is the terrace room with the balcony and the boganivilla. Just a step away from the roof top that has some amazing views of the sea and the town. I have gotten to know many of the staff over the years....they have personally shown me some of the greatest places to eat - shop and sunbath in Playa also setting up all my travel to and from the hotel - never missing a beat and making my trips a true luxury. The rooms are clean and comfortable with all the amenties I could ever want to unwind and rejuvenate. Seeing as I own two restaurants when I do get away - I long for nothing more than to be mindless and carefree knowing I am safe and among people who work towards my enjoyment. My next stay will be in the newly built addition to the hotel which is done supurbly with the village and the garden. And may I say the cleaning staff has remained the same since I have been going - I trust them all completely and never has a thing been out of place when they finish. The Kinbe and it's Rates - Staff and Amenities have made me continue to travel to Playa. It's all Luxe: The Comforts of Home by the Sea

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Terebv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in February 2009 and had a great time. Location is great, just a few steps from the heart of 5th Avenue which is great because you can really experience Playa del Carmen. The beach is just half a block down. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Service is good, we had a problem with the security box and they fixed it right away. Somedays it was a little bit noisy at night since there is a Bar just around the corner but if you plan to party at night and can sleep over a little bit of noise you'll do just fine. I would definetly recomend it for young couples and friends.

Reviews.Title: “No Return Stay/No Recommendation Ever”
Reviews.Author: cormac55
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with some trepidation due to previous reviews. It seemed a "hate it or love it " kind of place. Our family was staying nearby and I couldn't book my usual hotel. First impression from the street is a nice, modern, garden style hotel. No problems reserving the "Moody" room which is the only style of four types that has two double beds. I asked about upgrading but no other doubles were there. Room was on the ground floor. It was small, dark and I could not sell the small half-table, two chairs and beds for five-dollars combined, at a garage sale. Scruffy, scratched, painted horrible furniture. The mattresses were OK. The bedding was leftover Motel 6 as were the towels. The windows had mis-matched curtains that covered your very basic slide bolt locks. The door lock was a button type that a small child could bounce against and open. The safe was a key type but unfortunately was not bolted securely and pulled away from it's anchors. A small plasma TV. Air conditioning was good. My sibling had it too cold for me and it took me two days to get an extra blanket, which was a bed spread from another room, that I finally got by walking into the housekeeping room. Twice Roger couldn't commit to a blanket. There was a phone from 1980-don't know if it worked. No radio or wake-up alarm device. The bathroom was so small knees got scraped while sitting on the commode. The mirror was suitable for children, adults have to crouch. The shower is tiny and numerous bottles of shampoos and soap cakes from previous guests were left on the only ledge- a small four inch space at the shower curtain that could only be reached by feeling around. Yuck. Now the positives: No apparent bugs. In fact the pest control truck was outside one afternoon. The shower head was A+ and pressure was very good. The TV was just fine. Air conditioner good and not too noisy. The courtyard area was nice, filled with flowering plants and whimsy decorative jugs, shells, "nature" art, etc. The maids did a good job of cleaning (what they could reach-see shower info.) and were very, very helpful and pleasant. The day desk manager with the long hair and retainer-sorry-didn't note her name- was very nice, accomodating in her llimited area of responsibiity. Sorry-the male desk manager was not very helpful, reluctantly explaining the beach club information only after we asked pointedly, and couldn't recommend a place for coffee. All in all, knowing this was a low/mid-price range, I think it runs around $150/night (purchased through package from Orbitz), I was disappointed and made the best of it, since I only slept/showered there and am pretty easy going. My luggage has TA tags.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central”
Reviews.Author: Reiserundt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in late January. Easy reservation by their website. Friendly, helpful and welcoming staff when check in. The hotel is new, and clean. We had room nr 2, it's on the ground floor. I would have preferd a room higher up... It's a garden view, and everyone walk by the window when going to their rooms. The higher up your room are, less guest are passing by your window. That depends on how much you pay. The rooms are small, but light. Almost no daylight. Tiled floor. Good beds. The aircon worked ok, but the ventilation is bad. There is a minibar with expencive stuff...If you place some of the bottles outside the minibar, when making place for your own bottles, you have to pay for it! Be aware. The security feels good, there is safe in the room. And 24 h staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Location In Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: torontojoanne1
Reviews.Content: The Kinbe Hotel is a very good, well located hotel, half a block from the beach. It has clean, air conditioned rooms that are good value. The hotel is efficiently run by the manager, Stefania. This hotel is a safe place for independent women travellers to stay. The beautiful, tropical garden adds to the ambience. Joanne --- Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Two star hotel with 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: JimJoy
Reviews.Content: I posted some photos of this hotel... "The real Kinbe Photos" I would not say this hotel is terrible but i will say it is grossly overpriced and thus a terrible value. Kinbe is a 2 star hotel painted up to impersonate a 4 star boutique hotel. The rooms are very very small, dark and have no air flow (see my posted pictures). The minibar is packed with overpriced useless items, $6 water and $14 tequila for example (see pics). The view from the room was nothing like the website (see pic). Overall, this hotel represents exactly what is making Playa an overprices tourist trap rather than a quaint beach side resort.. Hotel Plaza right next store is half the price with bigger rooms. Recommendation: Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spiritus12
Reviews.Content: Very agreeable and charming hotel, 50 meters from the beach. Exceptionally friendly staff. Our room was spacious and nice , absolutely no complaints. You get a certain amount of noise from neighboring nights spots, especially Basico, which is great - but then you do not go to Playa for silence... We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “not what they advertised”
Reviews.Author: fauxlatina
Reviews.Content: The room photos on the website were not even close to the rooms we stayed at - the photos must have been photoshopped or taken with an extremely wide-angled lense. The rooms were tiny (room enough for a bed with no nightstands or other furniture) and uncomfortable. While the staff were nice, it took several calls to get them to check the problems in the bathroom (which they never did) and days to get a new bar of soap.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Johnson09
Reviews.Content: very expensive as compared to similar hotels no view we had to buy soap and shampoo the A/c was not working properly lots of mosquitos bathrooms were dirty Be careful in giving the management your credit card info!

Reviews.Title: “A Total Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: IRW
Reviews.Content: If you plan to ruin your vacation, this is the best choice. Bathrooms floors are dirty; they copied our credit cards and when we went back home, we noticed several charges (from Mexico) on our credit card. Hotel Konbe was the only place that had our card!! Far from the beach, noisy rooms. Lots of mosquitos in the rooms! Air conditioner wa snot working properly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: lilnestegg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kinbe is a cool hotel, right in the center of Playa Del Carmen. I first booked the 'garden room'- when I arrived, I didn't like it at all- too small, narrow, hot, and smelled quite musty. Very rustic (too rustic) and not impressive for the price. So, I upgraded to their best room, which was very nice. Contemporary, sleek decor. Tiled bath, balcony, desk area... and, just a block from the beach. Probably not a great pick for a family, as it's in the center of activity, so it's very loud, late into the night. But, it's great to wake up and have all the shops and eating venues right around the corner, from local places to Starbucks. The owners of this hotel also own/run a very hip/trendy restaurant just across the street, as well as a wine bar around the corner. Would I stay here again? Maybe- only because there seems to be so many cool places to check out in the area.

Reviews.Title: “small but quaint”
Reviews.Author: broonaler71
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be great value. We had booked the cheapest type of room - a pretty room. Room 17 - was on the second floor looking over the gardens. The room was very small but had mini bar which was not expensive and a decent shower and a wall mounted plasma tv with great reception. We had booked the small room as we had not planned on being in it that much as doing trips away. The bed was comfy and clean. Despite the close proximity to 5th Ave you could not hear any noise in the room - which was really good. The only problem the hotel had while we were there were a couple of plumbing problems, meaning the water went off for a few hours. Hopefully they have got this sorted. It would not stop us staying there again. The pool is nice and quite deep although we only saw us using it and that was once after a trip to Tulum. We travalled to Tulum on the local collectivos which are about five minute walk away and are really cheap, better than a taxi or ADO bus. Once there its also dead cheap to get in, but watch out for the time share reps who give you the maps on the way in We did take up their offer to tour a resort up the coast the next day with a free breakfast. The tour and pitch lasts 90 mins and if you can stand your ground against sales pressure like we did, we came out with half price tickets to Xel - Ha, saving $80 - result! Doing a trip to Tulum your self is a lot cheaper than an organised trip and don't combine it with a trip to xel-ha, as most advertise, as there is plenty to see and do at both, too much for one day. We also went to Xcaret booked through Alexis at the hotel. We went for the night show but you get there early enough to enjoy the other attractions as well. The staff were always helpful and available, there is a great roof terrace with views of Playa where we enjoyed a few night time beers before moving to 5th avenue. The hotel has no eating facilities so used the starbucks opposite for breakfast except one morning when we went to Sensai on the beachfront which the hotel promotes use of. We had loads of food for a very reasonable price. Its also quite chilled there on a night, some nights showing films on a big screen on the beach, where you can lie on loungers. Ovreall this hotel is conveniently located in the centre of Playa and great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Turr
Reviews.Content: I had been in Kinbe hotel 4 times over the last 5 years. The property is clean and functional. The staff is great specially Stefania, the manager. It's only 3 minutes away from the beach and famous 5ta. Avenida. I would definately recommned this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kinbe”
Reviews.Author: cookiebeast
Reviews.Content: I saw positive reviews in Expedia and decided to go for this hotel. For the price I paid, I was extremely happy. Room was small but clean, complete with a mini fridge, a plasma TV and full A/C. No bath tub, but the shower had good pressure. Bathroom is pretty funky looking. The hotel is in good location, less than a block from 5th Avenue and one block away from the beach. Note that if you prefer quiet, this is not the place for you. At night, you can hear bars and clubs having loud music. And there's a construction nearby, which is unavoidable because there appears to be construction everywhere nearby the beach. So there's some construction noise in the morning. To sum it up, I enjoyed my stay at Kinbe. Good location, friendly staff, ask the front desks for discounts. They will gladly help you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and low value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dvd1980
Reviews.Content: During my stay in Kinbe hotel I had an excursion to Chichen Itza, so I asked the reception to wake me up at 6:45, because I had to be in Plaza Antigua to wait for the bus at 7:50. The next morning I woke up at 7:48 (no one had waken me up) so we dressed extremely quickly and ran to the Plaza. We got there at 8:00 extremely tired and luckily the bus waited for us. I didn't missed the excursion but I forgot to put the tickets, the bathing suit (to swim in the Xenote), the money (to buy the cheapest art craft in the area and buy food or beverages), and the sun cream, luckily I didn't forget the camera. Besides that it was very uncomfortable to be the whole day without having taken a bath or washed the teeth. When we got back to the hotel I asked for the receptionist to talk to the Manager, he told us she was busy at that time (19:00) and that he would call us later. At 21:00 we walked down, tired of waiting and the receptionist told us, that we could talk to her (why didn't he call us??). We explained her the situation, and she said that it wasn't that important, because we could go to Chichen Itza anyway, and that there was nothing she could do to solve this problem (she offer as the only possible option to kill the receptionist). That we should relax, and she complained that I threw the keys in the morning to the reception (I was running to get the bus I said) and that the wake up service was not the obligation of the hotel (The hotel says it has the service in internet). We ask for a discount at least and she reluctanty offer a 10% discount. Then I said that wasn't enough and she told me we were taking advantage of the situation. We wanted to leave the hotel, but she asked us to pay the night we had slept there and the following night (because it was later than 12:00 pm). I think the attitude of the administration has been the worst customer experience in my life so I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Besides that the rooms are infected with ants, they say it's the tropical weather, but I stayed in other hotels without this problem. Another problem is that I rented an ocean view room and I could only see a tiny strip of sea between the buildings and construction sited, the manager said that it used to have sea view, but they are still offering as an ocean view in the internet. Please, don't stay in this hotel, you can find better place for the same money and much better place for a tiny difference (and with breakfast included).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: norwegian79
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Kinbe Hotel for a week. We were supposed to stay there for just a couple of days, but liked the place so much that we prolonged our stay. If you're tired of annoying resort hotels, we would recommend this charming little hotel located in the middle of Playa Del Carmen. The young people in the staff speak english and are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are quite small, but clean and cosy, and the AC works well. The suites are really something else - amazing - so check them out if you want something special. This hotel is well worth the money - and we will definitely come back. PS! We'd also recommend the massage studio on the other side of the street of the hotel. The people there will give you a really impressive (and cheap) one hour massage. Starbucks is just 50 metres up the street, but don't go there for your morning espresso. Instead - walk around the corner of Starbucks and visit the little french/mexican coffee house. They serve the best espresso ever tasted in Playa Del Carmen! You can see the beach (100 metres) from the entrance of the hotel. Go watch the sunrise early in the morning. Beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing but OK”
Reviews.Author: passi0n4travel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com as we needed a place booked for our first few days in mexico. It was ok, but i don't think I would stay here again. The decor of the hotel grounds is very funky and nice. But our room was very small and smelt of damp. The damp smell was from the aircon..... It was tricky to leave the windows open during the day while the aircon was off to let some fresh air in as the window was right next to the walkway and would have been easy people to climb in. Also there weren't any insect nets over the window so leaving the windows open will let bugs in. The bed was quite small and not really that comfortable. Not much storage. However, on a positive note the room was relatively clean and also quiet at night. The shower was pretty nice. The sink was beautiful but a silly shape so that you can't wash or brush you teeth in it very easily - so pointless really! The staff were a little snooty and not as welcoming as other places I have stayed in Mexico, however when we asked them to call ahead and book us a place in Cozumel they did do this for us. When we left they tried to charge us for things from the minibar that we had not used, they said they would take them off the bill but once our credit card bill arrived the minibar charges were still on there. The hotel was in a good location, very short walk to the beach and the main strip. There is a roof terrace which is nice, would have had lovely views of the ocean.... but there is a big appartment block being built in the way..... the construction of which was very loud at times. The hotel served its purpose as our base for our first few days in Mexico, but I wouldn't stay here again.... there were lots of of other nice looking places to stay in Playa, including Hotel Lunata, where we also stayed a couple of days later after visiting Cozumel for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but know what you're getting”
Reviews.Author: Ray_Art
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & myself stayed for 5 nights in July. We have mixed feelings about the hotel possibly because a tropical storm kept us indoors for 2 days. We have to agree that the location is excellent with both the heart of the bar/restaurant/shopping area and the beach being less than 1 minute walk away. We booked the 'Garden room' which was supposedly a good quality 2-storey room for USD120 per night. It was a horrendous room with the bed in the loft - it was dark, dirty with old furniture & as far as I can tell, you could not flush toilet paper down the toilet so it would have been nice & smelly too. We immediately upgraded to the best room at USD 180 per night. This room was very nice (clean, reasonably spacious, good a/c and a decent bathroom although shower water pressure was poor). However, for this room rate we were a little disappointed that the hotel did not serve breakfast or have a bar. However, I guess this is not really a big deal since you're in the heart of Playa.. So not a bad hotel at all - excellent for the location but not particularly good value for money (maybe because it is the 'authors choice' in the Lonely Planet..).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: torrentduck
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults/2 kids) just returned from our trip to Playa del Carmen (June 17-24) and I can't say enough good things about our stay at this hotel. There are two sides of this hotel; a sleek, newer, more modern (and very beautiful) side and a more tropical side with lots of lush plants growing in the courtyard. We stayed in one of the rooms on the tropical side. Our room had two beds, one of which was in a loft. If I had to put a negative on anything, it would be that the stairs up to the loft were very narrow so we had to take care going down them and there was no storage in the loft for clothing. Other than that, the room was comfortable, with good air conditioning and a safe. The desk staff were the friendliest I think I have ever experienced. We were in and out of the hotel many times during our stay and each person on the desk remembered us and warmly greeted us each time we came through the lobby (which is also very beautiful). Also, each person spoke English and gave us wonderful advice to help us negotiate our way through town during our first few days there. Hotel is situated one block from the ocean and one block from the busy, and very fun, 5th Av. GREAT find.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Place in the Center of it all”
Reviews.Author: iamkasiaNYC
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with this beautiful and classy hotel. We came down for a wedding that was being held at one of the most expensive resorts on the strip. As a result, we stayed here the night preceeding the wedding to save money and also because wedding events were happening in PDC that night. I researched extensively before we booked here, and every positive review I read was true. This place is a classy, posh, charming little gem in literally the BEST location in town. It is literally inbetween the best shopping/pedestrain thouroughway and the beach. If you need a place to stay in town, don't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: LJPG
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay in Playa. In my opinion, if you stay at a big resort, your missing out on the best part of playa del carmen. Yes, it may be small, but it is in the most perfect location- right off of fifth avenue. If you are staying in playa, especially on fifth avenue, you won't be spending much time in your hotel anyway, so the kinbe served is purpose well. Also, the beach is a few steps away from the hotel, which was great. You can either bring your own towel or rent out a nice couch like lounge chair at the little beach club they have right there for 5 dollars. It was beautifully decorated and very clean. What an amazing atmosphere. The garden setting was so relaxing! We did not have one problem during our stay. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. I also read a lot of other peoples reviews that said the noise from a nearby club was keeping them up at night, but I definitely didn't have that problem. I'm not sure what they were talking about. Also the beds were really comfortable, I slept like a baby every night. Don't listen to bad reviews about this hotel because it was such a great find! I will be certainly be staying at the Kinbe the next time I am in Playa. I absolutely loved this hotel : )

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for beach and local night scene”
Reviews.Author: TifTif
Reviews.Content: Kinbe was the PERFECT place to stay for our one night in Playa del Carmen. We chose it because of its location and the price! It was an extremely short distance from the beach and an extremely short distance from the 'Bourbon St.' of the Riviera Maya. Kinbe was cute and clean and had an extremely friendly staff. The room we stayed in was small, but that was what we asked for. The pool was refreshing and it was just a unique cheap clean convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a more perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: museumtrekker
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Kinbe for our Honeymoon after a co-worker came back raving about the place. I knew we had made the right choice when, after booking, I e-mailed them to see if they could arrange for champagne in our room upon arrival and they were able to do it for a very good price. They also were able to arrange for transportation for less than a cab ride ( we normally wouldn't hesitate to take the bus but since we were on our honeymoon we thought we'd make everything as stress free as possible). When we got there I just had to step back and smile. The place is beautiful! You are welcomed in an open and airy minimalist designed lobby by their extremely friendly staff ( props to all the staff - they were so kind and helpful). To the right is a atrium of sorts full of lush greenery and flowering hibiscus. To the left is a sleek pool with a copper wall that serves as a water fountain. Both sides are extremely different but both are extremely wonderful. We booked the Moody room on the tropical side. The room was a good size for the two of us with a huge bed, a closet (filled with a great mini bar), a futon chair and a small bistro table and chairs. My only complaint was the hardness of the bed but, having traveled through out Mexico, I have yet to find a soft bed unless for some reason I am staying at an Americanized establishment ( which I try to avoid). If you are looking for the Hilton the Kinbe is not for you. If you are looking for a romantic, charming hotel with a local feel then book right away. The location couldn't be better - less than a block to the beach and 5th Avenue. I could go on and on but I won't , just go and experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: donde_el_playa
Reviews.Content: Great place! We stayed here for two nights and loved it. It's right where you want to be - close to the beach and 5th ave shopping. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I am very happy with the price I paid for the room/location/service that we got. Room and hotel were clean - very pretty design (lots of green inside). Only downfall was that our room was a tad on the small side beceause because everything else was so great that didn't bother us at all. I've been to Playa twice now and this is my favorite place so far.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Kinbe”
Reviews.Author: sunfuzz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kinbe from Feb. 17-22, 2008. I was quite worried about the hotel before we went due to reading negative past reviews. I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is sleek, modern, extremely clean - it is so nice! Our room was beautiful with a new plasma tv, balcony, crisp white sheets, lovely bathroom with little soaps & shampoos, plenty of towels, etc. I would like to address three comments that I have read about this hotel that I don't agree with. Firstly, the bed was the best I have slept on in Playa del Carmen. The mattress seemed new, and was an actual mattress; not the typical bedroll that I've experience in the past at other Playa hotels. It was firm, but not hard. I really don't understand what people were complaining about. We have stayed in Playa 6 other times, and usually stay at the Hotel La Tortuga, the number 1 rated hotel on this website, and I can honestly say that the beds are a hundred times better at the Kinbe. Secondly, we found the front desk to be so helpful and friendly. Fabrizio in particular was awesome! Lastly, we thought that the minibar was not a rip-off. For example, I am reading this from our hotel receipt, we had : 1 can of pringles potato chips 1 corona beer, bottle 1 bottle of sprite soda and in American dollars we were charged $6.09. I don't think that is so horrible. But again, I don't understand what people were complaining about. Overall, our stay at the Kinbe was excellent. Playa itself seems to be getting overdeveloped, way too expensive and too full of people especially at this time of year. But it is the top of the high season, so I probably shouldn't complain about that. I would just like to reassure people that they should have no reservations about staying at the Kinbe. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “location..location....location”
Reviews.Author: sunpeggers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks at Playa and as always...just loved Playa. We arrived on Sat. Feb the second and discovered that beer was not going to be available until Monday morning, due to Elections on Sunday....Yikes... Not the kind of suprise we hoped for...to start our Vacation.... The mini bar in our room saved the day however.... Our room at the Kinbe was very small....And I mean very small. My wife and I travel very light so with a little planning we made ourselves comfortable. After a run to the store to confim no sevazas were to be had, the staff came to our rescue with loads of those tiny Coronas... There is a new condo going up next to the old alfarro light house.... Unfortunatley an all to common site now in Playa del Carmen. We could find no vacancy right on the beach this year ...so we booked the hotel Kinbe based on it's location. (just half a block off the sand) Just steps from the hotel we had our feet in the cool coral sand.. Ahhh... Playa. The hotel was as described ...Kind of a funky little place with lots of the old Playa charm... On the roof terrace you can watch the stars and obsorbe the ambiance of Mexico....(nice) We found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful. If your looking for a real taste of the old Playa... Hotel Kinbe is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely, Very Simple”
Reviews.Author: Evalishus
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Very simple with no ammenities really to speak of, but extremely charming. Flat screen TVs (no internet) and lovely modern Zen-ish decor. My stay was very quiet and no real noise from the near-by clubs could be heard at night. The beds are rock-hard, but this is usually the case in Mexico so I never understand why people are so surprised by it. The staff were all surprisingly young (looked to be in their 20's) but VERY professional and polite and spoke very good English. The roof top terrace is a great place to sunbathe, but bring up your drinks and snacks and towels as there isn't really anything up there. The patio furniture is seriously lacking. This is not a 5 star hotel by any stretch but it is a very funky & cool little hotel. It was VERY clean and the staff were very nice. Maybe a little overpriced but you are paying for location after all. I would highly recommend this place to anyone except maybe families (not sure if rooms are big enough).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Horrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: sparmelee
Reviews.Content: Me & my Boyfriend decided to go to Cozumel and had to check out the beach's in Playa so I found this place a what a deal and great location!!! You have to check out the massage place across the street best place ever and get deals!! The only problem I had with this hotel was the bed the most uncomfualbe I've ever been in my life!! Room was just a room but a great room very well designed!! But the bed was hard....I'm use to a really soft bed and theirs was not, But again it was not home. Great pool next time we go I would stay there again maybe for 1 night by the pool....I hear the rooms are better on that side. If you looking for something by the beach this is your place!! The staff was very nice and help us with all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good memories have no price!”
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian_travels
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to rate this hotel since it is so different from the type of accomodation I would normally choose to spend my vacation days in. Most good hotels in the Playa area are the 'closed-resort' type, which I wanted to stay away from in order to get first-hand experience of Mexico. Hotel Kinbe seemed to be the best fit for this requirement of mine - it was located one block from the Playa del Carmen beach and one block from the main street with all the restaurants, shops and bars. Location is probably the hotel's absolutely best feature. The hotel is difficult to describe in words - everything in seemed to be handmade, including steps, bed, bathroom, front desk, lampshades... except for the windows, the AC unit, and the shower curtain(?). It was primitive but for some reason, very charming (and I dont get "charmed" very easily, especially by 2 star accomodations). We booked a junior suite, which esentially is a small size room (the 'normal' rooms are very very very small) - the price was something like $40 a night, which is also the cheapest I have ever paid to sleep somewhere. The only thing I was unprepared for and disliked was the very strong musty smell of mold... we had to buy an air freshner spray and spray real hard before entering the room every time to SOMEWHAT choke the smell. The hotel staff is esentially 1 front desk person, polite and with a good command of of English. Nothing to write home about, but no negatives to share either. I am not sure if I will ever choose to stay in Kinbe again, but to me, it still brings good memories for some reason. For travellers on a budget, who know what to expect and are fine with it, it may be a great choice. PS - If you rent a car from Cancun (Playa is a 1hr easy drive from Cancun), you can use it for daily sight-seeing trips from Kinbe. Street parking is usually not a problem. I recommend visiting Xel-Ha, Xcaret (definitely see the show at park close!) and Tulum. We did not have time for Chitzen-Itza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Don't expect too much either...”
Reviews.Author: woete
Reviews.Content: We booked Kinbe because it was Lonely Planet's author's choice and after checking its website... Based on the website's athmosphere and the rates, we expected a bit more of this "zen", "stylish", "spa" athmosphere in the hotel too. The central garden IS very nice, the shower finishing is very original, the balcony is comfortable! Really not a bad word about the service and the comfort, just it doesn't correspond fully to the athmosphere radiated by its website. Its strongest point: its location so close to the lovely beach (only a minute!) and right in the centre of town! Advice: book via their website (you'll be redirected to ihotelier.com)! The rate we paid was substantially lower than the official rates mentioned on the reception desk in the hotel. We paid 79 USD for a "Moody" double room. No breakfasts offered, no internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Kinbe - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carecat21
Reviews.Content: After staying at many upscale all-inclusive resorts, my husband and I wanted a change. What we were looking for was a nice place to rest our heads, near the beach and in close proximity to shopping and restaurants. We didn't need anything super luxurious but wanted a place that had a character all it's own. The Kinbe fit the bill perfectly! We stayed in the least expensive room and although the room was small, it was very clean and we even had an ocean view. The rooftop terrace was an excellent place to watch the sunrise and enjoy the ocean breeze. The garden area was beautiful and the waterfall was also very nice. The shopping and restaurants within walking distance are endless and the beach is less than a block away. As long as you do not go expecting the amenities of a 5 star resort, I think you will love the Kinbe!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Selvig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kinbe, after driving around all of Playa del Carmen. The manager was extremely nice and even though they had been closed for Hurricane Dean, they let us stay in the Hotel. The bathrooms are perfect, the rooms are beautiful. We stayed in the junior suite and the days that we spent there were extremely relaxing. Thank you Stefania, you did a phenomenal job at making sure we felt at home, welcome and we had everything we needed. A/C, best water pressure in the Yucatan, quiet so close to the center of Playa but so silent, wonderful staff. Close to the beach and everything you may want in Playa,

Reviews.Title: “Definitly Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Odomca27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went because my family went down there for my Aunts wedding. My dad stayed at the Kinbe with us (not in the same room) to save $$$. The rest of my family stayed at all inclusive places and I'm so glad we didn't because we got to eat at all the different restaurants and it was amazing! The hotel was very pretty and clean. I admit that it was more moist but there arn't windows, only shutters which made it feel very laid back and rustic. I noticed looking at websites now that they must have had a huge addition so we stayed in it before the addition. The lot next to the hotel when looked down upon from the roof looked like someones cheap home that was completely destroyed from the hurricane. The roof was gone though it was made of grass and you could see the kids toys and fridge inside. This must be where the addition is. We stayed in a garden room with a loft which was a lot of fun. The air conditioning helped a lot at night but we didn't want a TV since we didn't spend so much time in the room and when we did have x-tra time we were on the beach that is amazingly close. There is a restaurant called 'natural' I think and we went there for breakfast 2 mornings and I completely recommend going there. We also went to 'Acos los tacos' that had the best guac and tacos. Ugh. I want to go back just writing this. It was a decent hotel, I guess the addition are the better rooms now. The staff was great when we were there, the water heated up nicely though the shower floor was large stones that was very uncomfortable to stand on.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Kinbe”
Reviews.Author: Clíona
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in the Yucatan Pen. for the month of July. We stayed in Playa del Carmen for a few nights at the beginning, and then headed down the coast. We saw the Kinbe when we were there and it was highly recommended by Lonely Planet so we booked it for our final 3 nights. I can't describe to you how disappointed we were. It looks great from the outside, with an indoor pool and a jungle of plants on view. But..... The room we stayed in the first night, was dark and very damp, and it didn't have the tv that we were promised. So we had to move for our second night. We were promised an up grade for the inconvenience, but when we went to the desk the following morning the receptionist was struck with a case of amnesia and we were moved to the same style room with an even smaller window but it had a tv. The pipe on the sink wasn't connected so we couldn't use it. I complained and was told it would be fixed when we came back from dinner. When we came home at midnight and I went to brush my teeth and the sink hadn't been touched. Needless to say I was furious and made a complaint and then eventually someone fixed it. The following day we didn't get as much as an apology. This room was as damp as the previous room, so much so all of our clothes were damp and sticky leaving the place, and I have a cold now as a result. On leaving when we paid they acted as if nothing happened and when I started to complain all he did was shove a questionnaire in my face and asked me to fill it in. We all know where that went when we left.....absolutely desperate, do not stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT-DIFFERENT ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: dardas
Reviews.Content: we've been to the Kinbe on March, when Playa was very buisy and crowded and we were very happy to find this place. its a beutifull hotel, the stuff was very nice and helpfull and the location is great. you should pay attention to the different kinds of rooms: the size,the facillities, the floor (there is no elevator) and the view. we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OttawaClaireBear
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had been backpacking for 2 weeks, and were at the end of our trip (and rope) when the cabana we were staying in down the beach turned out to be disgusting. So we decided to "splurge" on the Kinbe after reading a review in the Lonely Planet. We spent $58USD a night for their junior room. It was luxurious! The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was lovely and the shower was warm and had lots of pressure. The mini-bar was much appreciated, and the food and drinks weren't even that expensive. The colours of the bedspread and curtains made it seem very tropical. It wasn't a large room, but it had everything you needed (except for a TV, but with the beach and the nightlife, you really don't need it). We didn't have a balcony directly off our room, but the walkway leading to the rooms have great views of the beach. The pool is SPECTACULAR! That was what impressed us when we first walked in, asking about a room. The pool is in an outdoor courtyard, with lounge chairs, and a waterfall that runs down a 4-storey wall into the pool. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the security is great. You leave your key at the desk, and there is 24-hour security guard. There is also a lockbox in the room, great for passports and cameras. I really can't say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kinbe, Playa del Carmen--bad experience”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTraveler89
Reviews.Content: The photos on their website are accurate--but, they are the public spaces. They look gorgeous. The room I got was another reality. First floor, windows looking out on pathway, to office on one side and laundry area on the other. You can't leave drapes open. If you did, you wouldn't see anything. A/C is of course necessary, so that white noise knocks out all the sounds from outside. But--the room smelled stale and distinctly noninviting. . . I had made the mistake of booking three nights ahead, plus a fourth night after a two-day trip to Cozumel. . . After a night, I asked at least that they cancel the fourth night and let me find another place. When the nice young man at the desk flatly refused to give me any money back, saying it was "policy", I asked to speak to someone else. I met a "fuerte" Italian woman in the office, who made me a "deal": I could cancel at my own risk, and she wouldn't charge me for the room if she re-rented it. . . Well, of course that was no "deal", but because it seemed a safe bet I took it. . . I went north many blocks and found an absolutely delightful accommodation--complete with personable owners and staff--at Fiesta Banana, away from all the hubbub and also near beach access. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Playa”
Reviews.Author: danzan
Reviews.Content: Kinbe is a great little hotel with a nice range of rooms. We stayed in the garden loft room with a terrific view of the beach. We found the staff wonderful and helpful and overall the hotel was a terrific value for the money. We have scouted just about every hotel in Playa for our wedding and Kinbe was one of the three we recommended (Alhambra and Mosquito beach were the others, and we would skip M. Beach of we could do it over again).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a perfect location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: giantsgrl
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at Hotel Kinbe. I was here two years ago and had a pleasant stay and with such a great location didn't hesitate to book here again. I called to make a reservation with Marianna then my booking was confirmed by Andrea. We arrived Sunday July 1st after a longish flight. . I was impressed immediately by the beautiful improvements they had made. The outside of the hotel looked great . Inside the reception area is amazing. The desk is right in the centre as soon as you walk in and we were warmly greeted checked in and shown up to our room which was called " Garden" .We loved our room it included a great large deck where we loved to sit out in the morning admiring the ocean view and in the evening relaxing after a day at the beach and having a drink and chatting. Room was great - king size bed a plasma tv to watch, well stocked mini bar and a lovely bathroom. The rooms are kept really nice and clean air conditioning worked great. The staff were really kind and helpful, we got excellent restaurant advice and all our questions were answered well and informative. It is just off the main street and we did not experience any problems felt safe and secure. Our room included a safe as well. We would usually walk to the Playa Tukan beach club which was a pleasant 10 minute walk along the beach. We liked this one as the had comfortable lounge chairs on the beach. On our departure the hotel arranged a shuttle for the airport which arrived right on time. We really enjoyed our stay here at Hotel Kinbe and would not hesitate to stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “A good average choice”
Reviews.Author: FinnishMexican
Reviews.Content: The Kindbé is a very well located hotel, with varying service. Some of the staff are very helpful, while others dont seem to understand that they are there to serve the client. For example, there was a rain storm, which meant that arriving to our room the entire floor was covered in water. At 7 pm we were told that the cleaning staff had left, but they could borrow us a mop to clean the floor ourselves... The hotel is also quite far from Playa Mamitas, which is the place on the beach to be! Prepare to walk about 10 blocks. Price wise the hotel offers good value for money compared to many other Playa del Carmen hotels. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but many in the surroudning area. Anther tip, there is a great little massage place right accross the street which is run by a swedish girl. The hotel doesnt accept American Express either, and this is not published anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: PEDSED
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 5 from 5/13 to 5/19/07. The staff was young and courteous, and they were helpful with tips for local dining and a bicycle rental. I stayed in the room described by the hotel as “Moody”. The room was a bit small, but the king size bed was perfect for 1 to 2 people. The room was immaculate. The air conditioner worked great. I had a flat screen LCD television with at least 50 channels to watch. There was a safe in the room so I always felt that my stuff was secure. There is only one hotel entrance, so I felt secure overall. The shower was the best I’ve ever experienced in the last 3 years of going to Playa (I used to stay at the Blue Beach Hotel, which is being demolished to make room for condos). The pool is clean and was a life saver after being in the Caribbean sun all day. The hotel is literally less than a block away from the beach. Overall, the Kinbe Hotel in a very nice place. It’s perfect for Playa del Carmen meaning that it is pretty and comfortable but not snobby. I can see where the noise could be an issue, as the place is centrally located in the heart of the shopping and restaurant district, but I found that drinking mas cervezas helped me fall asleep in spite of the noise. I will stay at Kinbe again. Paul D. from Houston TX.

Reviews.Title: “Hop skip and a jump to all you need in Playa”
Reviews.Author: whistlz
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Playa Del Carmen, the Kinbe hotel is in an ideal location. A hop to the beach, a skip to aviendo 5, and a jump to some of the best restuarants and shops in Playa, make this hotel one of the best to stay at. It is a fair size, but small enough to be cozy, surrounded by beautiful lush trees, and gardens on one side, and a pool on the other. The pool is very clean, and the new renovation has made the entrance quite funky. The rooms were clean, the showerhead made for the best shower in Mexico. The staff all spoke exceptional english, and were very professional. The only difficulty we had was obtaining a room earlier than planned, as we arrived very late to find the security guard, who did not speak enough english to book us a room. We ended up at the Hotel Riviera Caribe Maya, and then moved the following day. A few days later, a couple from Holland were trying to check in after midnight, and having much difficulty, due to the security guard being on duty. They got a bit frustrated at the fellow, asking "don't you speak english", and thought I should mention here, that this is Mexico, and it is wonderful when people speak good english, but just imagine, if we could speak Spanish, in their country! A dictionary is always handy. I don't expect staff to speak a language that is foreign to their home! We felt this hotel was very safe, and were pretty casual about leaving electronics and our passports in our room. Will certainly stay at this lovely hotel again. (For those who read reviews about the noise, yes it's true...no matter where you go in Playa, they are building everywhere, so if it isn't your hotel, it's the hotel next door.) It's a beach town, meant for colour, vibrance, fun, and since us touristos keep going, they keep building. (The whole coast is destroyed from Cancun to Tulum...)

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: yvonneluna
Reviews.Content: "That won't happen to me!" , I thought when I read the bad reviews. Sure enough, they did. I thought I would be the exception, especially because I had been e-mailing back and forth with Andrea at the hotel. When we get there, they told us we did not have a room because the one we booked had burned down!!! This is when they decide that they would look for another hotel to place us in! I was Livid! The next day when we show up there, they give us our room and literally, it's just a room! We were better off at Riviera del Sol where they placed us the night before. To top it off, we could here music and feel the vibrations from the club next door, Voge, until 4 am! Sure I went to have a good time, but once you are ready to sleep, you want to sleep in peace. This never happened here. I was very disappointed with Kinbe and I would never stay there again. Lastly, every time you leave your room, you had to turn in the keys! Are they trying to see who's not in their room; I don't think that's any of there business! Hope this helps, Yvonne

Reviews.Title: “Lied from the start”
Reviews.Author: lotsatravel4me
Reviews.Content: CAlled the hotel directly , asked to 2 beds .. they said yes room has 2 beds... got there one is a bed one is a futon... after many excuses we deciede to rent room. Had to climb literally 5 flights of stairs... NO ice machine, NO TV, tolets barely flush so you must put your paper in waste basket. Then 3rd Night they rented our room to someone else after we CONFIRMED our stay with the front dest that morning. They put our belongings in trash bags and put us on the street at 8pm at night! I have never been treated so poorly. Went across the street to hotel calibra rate was only $66 a night and on the beach vs $133. Look its got charm and the pictures look good, but the rooms are very small and do not represent the best value in Playa... Many hotels are there close by so I would not make this my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Playa at Your Own Pace”
Reviews.Author: LaMarianina
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was spotless. The front desk staff were friendly and gave excellent information. Close to the beach and great night life. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Kinbe stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kirbykim
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our room and our 7 day stay at Kinbe! Like others have already stated, if you are an “all in” type person this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a great location and love to be in the “middle of the action” this IS the place for you. With Kinbe being located in downtown Playa del Carmen, there were so many great restaurants, stores and shops, night hotspots for the party person in you, and last but not least the beautiful blue Caribbean Sea just one block down the street. But if you are a person who is early to bed, then the noise may be a problem for you. We stayed in room number 13. It has a great balcony with views of both the beach and of part of 5th Ave. The hotel grounds are beautiful, the cleaning staff was fine and the front desk folks were always friendly and went above the call of duty during our stay. Two thumbs up from Kim and Kirby, we will come back to Playa Del Carmen and to the Kinbe Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: lazybeacher
Reviews.Content: Its funny how some people hear noise! We stayed 10 nights at the Kinbe in January and found it to be a very gracious hotel and would stay again. The small amount of noise amounted to a hammer bing once in a while. No loud electric drills, or saws of any kind. We found the natural way of building the new wing to be very refreshing and rather enjoyed watching how it can be done by hand without power tools. Amazing to watch. Our room was one of the small rooms, double bed. Yes it was different from home, but very clean and comfortable. The bath is small, but clever in design and more than functional. The a/c can freeze you out. We had to ask for an extra blanket! We very much enjoyed the roof top view. We could sit all afternoon and enjoy the view of the ocean. For the great price of this hotel, you will not be dissapointed. Location is the best in Playa. 75 feet to Starbucks and Java Joes, which I prefer, and Hagendaz across the street. Then 75 feet in the other direction is the beach. Staff was most helpful and very honest. They would do anything to make your stay enjoyable. We look forward to returning again to Hotel Kinbe. Thank you for a great 50th birthday party that lasted 10 days. Ps. If you are looking for the Hyatt or Marriot stay home. I give Hotel Kinbe a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MexicoTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay through there website. Photos are misleading. Arrived there and the room smelled of mildew and workers were renovating our floor . Room was very cramped and dark! This is a place for teens who just need a place to crash.They offered us another room for only one night of our stay and said we would be back in this room after- no exceptions. My wife was extremely unhappy. We asked if they would just cancel our reservation and we would move on. She said sure but we will charge you anyway. It was so bad we left and took our chances. I did end up paying for the stay we never had because the hotel did run the charge. Stay away from this hotel. Customer service is non existent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with right price”
Reviews.Author: ScubaJennifer
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the heart of Playa. Simple walk to beach, right off of main shopping/restaurant strip (5th Ave) and good dive shop right across the street. Room was small and simple, but quaint, warm property and staff. This is not a place for people looking for the elegant or fancy accommodations. The closet and the bath room are tiny. The stairs to most of the rooms may be tough for people with limited physical ability. There was construction noise all day, but with the building boom in Playa you would be hard pressed to find a quite location. Besides, if peace and quiet is what you are looking for, then you should not be headed to Playa del Carmen anyways. Try Akumal or Tulum for a tranquil Mayan getaway.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trig456
Reviews.Content: this place is absolutely gorgeous and has so much ambiance! a unique boutique hotel, not your average and boring chain... Even the standard rooms are very pretty! there's also a rooftop with a beautiful view and the beach plus the main street is only a few steps away. the owner is very friendly and when i was there she gave us breakfast coupons for a near by Italian coffee place serving delicious croissants and cappuccino!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Playa place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rortenzi
Reviews.Content: This is quite simply my favorite place to stay in Playa. The hotel is very, very affordable and you couldn't ask for a better location. We walked to everything and felt like we were right in the perfect place to do so. It's a very cute and cozy place to stay and I always recommend it to friends. I posted some pictures that I took of the views from my room. Such a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Trav3l
Reviews.Content: Pro's of my experience *Cute hotel with tropical feel * Close to beach * Extremely close to 5th st * Walking distance to bus stations * Nice breezy view from the patio on top of hotel * Nicely renovated bathroom Con's of my experince * Constant construction on all sides * Power and Water went out and there was NO effort made by the staff so ended up sleeping on that upstairs patio due to the unbearble heat and couldn't even take a shower to cool off. Booked on Hotels so couldn't cancel, but ended up leaving as soon as possible in the morning. * NO POWER and NO WATER the ENTIRE STAY except the first 2hours (only at the hotel one night) * Tons of tiny stairs with no elevator * EXTREMELY small room ... barely enough room to walk around the bed * When there was power, the ac did not cool very well * No TV, when hotels claims to have them * TERRIBLE Restaurant experience next door - DO NOT EAT THERE Besides the construction, and the lack of electricty and water for the ENTIRE night the hotel is fairly decent and inexpensive with a good location. It would have been less expensive to book direct through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad timing...bad experience”
Reviews.Author: brunettegirl_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cute but when we were there, there was construction next door and there was no air conditioning in the room...nor any windows for air circulation and no running water at night! It was the worst night I've ever had as it felt like our room was a stale 120 degrees. In the morning we checked out and booked ourselves at another hotel. The staff understood and I admit that it wasn't their fault the power was out...but I wasn't about to stay and find out if it was just a one night issue. Ask the hotel about the construction before you book your stay. The heat at night was a common compliant among all guests there, not just us, I found out after meeting another girl with the same issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSquirrel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Kinbe on for one night as a stopover on the way to the airport. The location is excellent, just a few steps from the beach and 5th avenue, which has great restaurants, nightclubs, and shopping. The rooms are very small but comfortable and well decorated. There are no elevators, so expect to carry your luggage up three flights of stairs if you are on the top floor. Staff will help you if needed. The staff is friendly to you if you are friendly to them. They have a selection of books in the back room for guests to borrow, and each room has a safe and a mini-fridge with drinks and snacks for purchase. This hotel is a good value for the price. My only complaint is that the bar next door is loud and lively and you can hear music thumping and people yelling long into the night. It was not loud enough from our room to keep me awake, but if you are a light sleeper I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the black plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: where do i begin. At hotel kinbe, i got $400 dollars stolen out of the safe in my room along with my cell phone. The hotel employes are the only individuals who have access to the room, however, the owner took no responsibility whatsoever. She would not help at all, and blamed the missing money on myself. She was very rude. Also, workers started hammering nails and working on the hotel every morning at 8:30 and continued throughout the entire day. One morning our hot water went out and we were stuck taking cold showers and another day our electicity was out so we had no a/c. it was 115 degrees outside, so you can imagine how hot it got in the room. There are lots of other hotels in the playa area that would be a much better choice. My advice is to avoid hotel kinbe, try to find a place you can trust. getting all of your vacation money stolen on the second day is not fun...believe me.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy hotel”
Reviews.Author: moorefa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in room #18. I really liked this hotel. Our room was one of the split level ones and looked out onto the courtyard. The stairs inside were a bit rickety and it was a bit dark - could have done with an extra lamp - apart from that it was very nice. The room was very clean and the maid service was always very good. Our room was very quiet - we couldn't hear any noise from the bars on the street. The a/c unit was good and kept the room cool. I liked the bathroom with its strange pebbley shower - might not be good if you are not very nimble on your feet though. The location is perfect, close to bars and restaurants and also a few metres from the beach. You can also walk along the beach to get the ferry to Cozumel. The rooftop terrace was great and you get a great view of the sea. This is a small hotel with plenty of character. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If i stayed there again i would perhaps request #19 as it had a few more windows. This is a good hotel for couples - maybe not so good for young children or older people due to the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful It's not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kinbe' is a good hotel and I can only speak for the room that we stayed in, room #6. Great View of the ocean, great balcony, very close to the street and the "goings on". Next door to the hotel is a hotel with an outside bar that plays house/tecno music every evening until about 2am. Needless to say it's very loud and made it difficult to sleep some nights. They did recieve a city noise ordaniance while we were there but it seemed to only curb the noise for a night or two. Also there are two construction sites right next to the hotel. One accross the street and the other on the opposite side of the building. Between the loud music and the construction it was difficult to get a good nights sleep. One particular night, the hotel had recieved many complaints from other guests I was told, was when there were some people working on a front door for the currency exchange that was located on the back side of the same building. Hammering and sawing until about 1am. The hotel only offered an appology and a handshake. I understand that this was not the hotels fault but it was the fault of the people that ran the currency exchange. Nothing was offered, and it seemed like nothing was done to accomodate the fact that my wife and I, and many other guests, were not allowed to sleep for most of the night. Customer service skills were lacking by management during this ordeal. Lastly, our package deal included round trip to and from Cancun airport. They never picked us up to bring us to the hotel when we first got there. We had to take a Van transport (which dropped us off 6 blocks from the hotel) and had to pay $18.00 US, which we were never compensated for. OK the good stuff about the hotel: The rooms were fantastic, very comfortable. No T.V. (your on vacation you don't need T.V.) Very Clean Rooms. Staff was pleasant. Night time desk clerk has the 411 on every thing, allow him to help you will be happy he did. Close to the beach, the pics on the website don't do it justice. Very Close to 5th ave. A/C cranks and does drown out the noise during the evening but doesn't take care of a pounding base amp from the bar next door. Price was right. If you get a chance take advantage of their pacakage deals, they are very easy to work with. I wouldn't stay there again I would try one of the other hotels along the beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is just perfect! Great location, 2 min of walk of the beach, 30 seconds from the main street where you can walk to find a great restaurant or boutiques. It was the best hotel of the week for us in our trip in Yucatan. If you pay cash there is a 10-15% deal. No Tv, small washroom, and i did not like the floor of the shower as it was tough for the feet but it was so perfect that even if the washroom is so small, this hotel is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kinbe is a small three-story hotel about a half-block from the main pedestrian drag and the beach. It has a small tropical courtyard and a rooftop deck complete with lounge chairs. We stayed during Superbowl weekend in 2006 in a small, one-bed room on the third floor. Yes, we had to bring up our bags, but we didn't have much, so thought nothing of it. And we didn't think the stairs were rickety. Instead we thought they were solid and cool. (The stairs and supports are cut from logs) We never had a problem with noise or hot water, either. The people who ran the place were great. They greeted us every time we left or returned to our room and even helped us when our taxi back to the Cancun airport was delayed. We also intermingled with some of the other guests who were very nice. The only regret about the place was that you can't flush toilet paper down the toilet, but for many small hotels in Playa, you can't do that. Maybe it's a small thing, but it's kind of gross. Although the cleaning service, emptied our trash daily. I thought it was a great place if you want to intermingle more with the local culture.

Reviews.Title: “Kinbe Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I reserved a room with double beds, A/C for $60US. When we arrived, we had to lug our bags up 2 floors of rickety steps (no help offered). The room was tiny, no A/C and ONE double bed. When we left- the girl at the desk called the manager/owner (Italian woman) when I was charged $75US. She said that all her standard rooms were single beds and blew me off as far as the cost. I paid of course. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone when there are some GREAT places for less in Playa del Carmen like Casa de las Flores.

Reviews.Title: “Kinbe is cool...”
Reviews.Author: DosCoronas
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Kinbe in Feb 2006. The staff was very friendly, helpful and responsive. Our two-level room was comfortable, clean and a bargain considering we were only one block from the beach. The rooftop deck was a treat too. We had an in-room safe and a mini-bar fridge. Our room was on the upper floor and the bed was located in a loft with a large window that allowed for nice breezes at night. We only used the AC one night when the breeze died. We had two additional windows downstairs too. Water pressure was good with plenty of hot water. The Kinbe does have drawbacks. Avenida 1 ends at calle 10 so a lot of traffic passes. Avoid the rooms on the street. There is typical city noise when the windows are open, but it's not terrible. PDC is pretty much a 24 hour carnival these days and the Kinbe is located near a lot of restaurants and clubs. There are many steps to climb to the third floor rooms and the roof deck. This is difficult when carrying heavy bags. We didn't have a car, but note that the Kinbe has no off-street parking. I like leaving the key at the desk. I didn't have to worry about dropping it somewhere, especially in the sand. Someone is at the front 24 hours. Overall, no real complaints and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Whats that smell?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My father and I came down to Playa del carmen for a couple of days for a meeting. He booked us at Kinbe, thinking it's price is reasonable and just how long would we be in the room. When we arrived at the hotel my first impression was actually great. Nice little quiet hotel. We checked in with the front desk and the girl at the desk showed us to out room. We were provided room #4. In a hurry and our taxi waiting to take us to our final destination we dropped off our luggage. When we entered the room the smell of raw sewage about knocked me off of my feet. We were told by the girl at the desk that the smell would be taken care of. When we went to leave, I locked the door and it could be pushed open with the slightest bump. We notified the girl at the desk and requested that she put us in another room. She declined and said she would have the door fixed. After explaining to her that we were leaving to go to a meeting and that our luggage was unsecured in a room that could not be locked and that we would like to change rooms she still was not helpful. Now I must say that the door lock was fixed upon our arrival back to the hotel but that awful stinch was not. They made it even worst by adding what I believe was viniger and bleach. After one night of staying in this hotel we opted out and took a loss and moved to another hotel. One thing that disturbed me was that when you leave the hotel to go out to the city you have to leave your key at the desk. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone that I know.

Reviews.Title: “Why some said Clean but some said Dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My hudsband and I just came back from Mexico (2-week trip from 27/1/06 to 13/2/06). In playa de carmen, we stayed in this hotel because of (1) recommended by Lonely Planet (book version Year 2005)(2) recommended by the agent in Cancun Airport showing us a hotel brochure with nice photos. We stayed 2 nights - one night at a standard room (USD 6X) and another night at an executive room (USD 8X). The hotel made such arrangement because standard room for 2nd night is fully booked. I now can explain why some of you said the hotel is tidy and clean but some said it is poor. In the room we stayed frist night, this is with a new split-type air-conditioning unit - the machine is efficent and new. Although both the toilet and bedroom floor is initially wet (make you very uncomfortable when you step in the room), the sleeping environment soon turns acceptable when you set the A/C on. The cleaniness of wall, floor, small table and toilet is also acceptable when considering the price is USD6X, although the room is really very small (the bed is small but still good for Asian People like us) . However, when we changed to that executive room next night, the situation is completely different. The window type A/C (obviously old type), the wall decoration (color defading and nearly falling down), toilet status, etc. are OLD and DIRTY. Also, because of the old A/C, the whole room has a bad smell... And this room costs us even higher - USD8X! When wandering around Playa De Carmen, there is really a lots of hotel to choose with a cheaper price too. So, don't believe solely in the hotel recommendation of Lonely Planet, Year 2005 upto now, there is already lots of changes - said so, because this is true even in other places of Mexico. I won't recommended this hotel. But if you still want, please choose a newer room (the feature is - the room with new split-type A/C shall be better; but be carefully NOT ALL standard room is with newer A/C!) P.S. I saw some guests complaining the room situation at the reception in one day morning too......

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised to read the recent reviews on the Hotel Kinbe. We stayed January 25th-February 1st and had such a great experience. I am kind of tired of people saying they weren't expecting a resort style hotel and then expecting a resort style hotel. The reality is for the price it can't be beat. When people complain and suggest another hotel it is always more money. We loved our room, #19, the rooftop deck, the location, the housekeeper and well we loved most things about the hotel. In fact another couple was looking at the hotel as we were headed out one day and we gushed so much about it they decided to stay. I hope they had as great experience as we did. Yes you have to put toilet paper in the garbage but you have to do this everywhere in town. The places that didn't request it seemed to always be clogged and overflowing. That is the sewer system in a mexican town not a U.S. city. Each day our housekeeper came and folded our clothes that were strewn all over the room from late night parties and wrapped up jewelry in safe location! We loved her and left her nice gratuity to say thank you. Yes the Blue Parrot burned down but I've watched a half a town be saved from burning in the USVI because we all picked up a hose. I wish everyone had a great experience like we did. I was a little nervous staying there and although the staff weren't our new best friends we were just so happy with the place. By the way, I can't emphasize how great the location is. Literally 3 doors down from 5th and not even half a block to great part of beach. In front of really expensive places the beach smelled, was filled with boats and rocks. This was our first time to Playa and we are already booking trip for next year. Would I stay at Kinbe again? Yes, I won't only because I don't like to stay or eat in the same place twice but would suggest others give it a chance. By the way, Playa is great but go down to Tulum beaches if you can. We rented a dune buggy for cheap and Tulum is a great break from people and expensive food and drinks. Try Charlies, the best margies we had in Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay at Hotel Kinbe!”
Reviews.Author: 888julieanna
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of Hotel Kinbe and seeing it not favorible, this saddens me. We stayed at the hotel in November of 2004 and it was amazing.
