At first I was a little scared to have a room with no TV or internet connection, but it turned out to make our experience in Playa that much more enjoyable. We stayed out later, enjoyed dinner on 5th Ave, talked more, went to the beach - which is steps from the room. If you are looking for a hotel like the Hyatt, or Hilton, or any large hotel that you would find in the states, this IS NOT for you. If you want to stay in your hotel room, and eat food from the cafe in the hotel, this IS NOT for you. Live a little, take a chance to step outside of your box! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't afraid to take a step off the beaten path. The rooms were clean, fresh towles and sheets everyday. There was never one notice of mold, or of sewage in our room. Nor did I hear anyone at the hotel complain of it. Remember, the hotel is in the tropics, it's humid... you have to turn on the AC everyday. One reviewer complained of a nearby bar and hotel burning to the ground while they stayed at Hotel Kinbe. Why would that make your stay at this hotel bad? I understand it must have been scary, but really.... The rooms and the hotel were just like the photos on ----. Looking at them brings back very fond memories!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a little over a week. It started out ok, except for the nasty sewer smell in the rooms, mold on the walls, loud a/c unit (that leaked), and a flood in our room on the third night from a little bit of rain. I actually would have kept my mouth shut if it wasn't for the terrible service (especially the manager), who made it clear to me that she did not care about our comfort or resolving any of our many issues. What's bad is I overheard a number of other customers with that manager, and all the conversations sounded the same as mine. I wasn't expecting the Hilton by any means when I went down there, but just a little bit of customer service would have went a long way. I will never go back to that hotel again, unless it is completely renovated and under new management. On the other hand I have also stayed at the La Tortuga, a little more money but well worth it. They actually care if they have happy customers. La Tortuga also has a nice pool, restaurant, bar, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience at the Hotel Kinbe!”
Reviews.Author: spiffyniffer
Reviews.Content: Recently, four of us stayed at the Kinbe for six nights, and were very dissappointed with the hotel conditions and management. We paid $80.00 per night and expected cleaner rooms at that rate. There was a musty smell in our room, #11 and black mold spots on the bathroom wall, shower curtain and on the built in shelf next to our bed. On our second night there we were awakened by a loud explosion as a car caught fire as well as the beachfront Blue Parrot Hotel Bar and Hotel Costa Del Mar, just across the street from the Kinbe, burned to the ground. We opened our door to glowing sparks and debris which landed on the roof of the Kinbe. My sister let the employees hook a hose up to her sink and we helped get the hose to the roof where small patches of the thatched roof were catching fire. At this point, we felt our safety was threatened, so we packed our bags and headed to another hotel 4 blocks away where the rest of our family was staying. Once our luggage and documents were safely there we headed back to the Kinbe. The air was extremely thick with smoke and burning our eyes, in short uninhabitable. Soon after arriving back at the Kinbe the police told us to evacuate as we sat on the hotel steps. We stayed the night with our family at a cost of $60.00 for all 4 of us( a very gracious rate, thanks to the Hotel La Tortuga). We returned to the Kinbe the next morning and asked them to refund the $60.00 that it cost us to stay elsewhere. To make a long story short after a few days of stalling they refused to pay the extra money that we were out. This seems like a pretty selfish way to make money considering we had stayed behind and helped to keep their hotel from burning down. The manager not only refused the refund, but was very rude stating that we should have talked to her instead of listening to the police, but we had never met her before then, so didn't recognize her in the confusion of a fire. On our third night I finally had to ask for clean glasses in our room since the same extremely filthy ones had been there since we checked in. The view from the roof was the only saving grace of this hotel, but the beachfront local also meant loud techno music until at least 4 a.m. kept us up all night. My sister's room #1, also flooded during our stay, and a foul sewer smell emitted from her bathroom. She was given 5 towels to deal with the water. All of her belongings were soaked. Again no refund, no apology, no new room and terrible customer service. We cannot reccommend the Hotel Kinbe to anyone planning to stay in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catty82
Reviews.Content: In Brief - Rooms good size, good location off 5th Ave and V near beach, really nice staff, nice decor, rooms slightly damp (maybe due to hurricane?), air con and room safe. I really liked this hotel. The rooms were a nice size and the beds were comfortable. we stayed in an executive room but would have been just as happy with a standard room as the only difference was the size of the bed. The shower was nice and strong and the water hot, the bathroom is also a good size. The hotel is not on the beach but its is a 2 min stroll at the bottom of the street. The air conditioning works really well and gets rid of the slightly damp smell that was in the room when we arrived. all in all I was very happy to sleep off my jet lag in this friendly and welcoming hotel, definitely a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Kinbe was a great choice”
Reviews.Author: cop0251
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at large resorts in Cancun and Puerto Rico and were looking for something as a quick vacation and not too pricey. We looked at several small hotels and non-AI places to keep looking at the charming Kinbe. We saw the small rooms and have experienced Mexico before, we booked our trip through Travelocity for a grand total of $1045 we were on our way to Playa for 5 nights. We arrived at Kinbe and checked in with Elena she let us look at a couple rooms to see which one we wanted. The first room was the two level room didnt want to climb steps to get to the bed. Then our original room which was not a king bed, then our king bed room which we paid an extra $20 a night for. It was just a king bed, small table and chair, and a bathroom. This was all we expected for our @$60 per night. We were pleased with the hotel completely. This is a great value in a great little town which is growing way too fast. We hope to go back soon, hopefully in May'2006. Thanks to Elena and the staff at Kinbe our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: skivob
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Kinbe. Although our room, #15, was small, (and the bathroom even smaller!), we found this hotel to be clean, comfortable, with a terrific location. The grounds and common areas were spotless and the staff was pleasant. If you like large, all-inclusive resorts, you will probably not enjoy the Hotel Kinbe, but if you need a clean, simple place to stay, we would recommend the Hotel Kinbe.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: GDX
Reviews.Content: For our honey moon we decided to go to Playa del Carmen as I was there several years ago, 1997/98, several times when I was working for one of the famous cruise lines. I used to like the more calm atmosfere found in Playa than the spoiled one of Cancun or West coast of Mexico, Acapulco, etc.. We did a bit of do it yourself so I found the hotel Kimbe through an Italian travel agent that has a dedicated web site about Playa del Carmen, then looked up some reviews on the tripadvisor about this hotel that looked OK so we decided to book it through this travel agent. We knew that hotel Kimbe had small rooms but it was close to the beach on 5ave. so it was enough. Thanks to a review found on tripadvisor we found out that the best room was the junior suite number 6 so we booked that one in particular, the #6 with confirmed e-mail and fax. The trip: After a long trip from Europe we arrived in Miami to catch our connection to Cancun. Here after more than an hour long waiting in a cue for to go through the US Immigration we finally made it to our gate to catch the Mexicana air conection to Cancun. Arrived in Cancun we found our luggage zipper locks broken, cut with pliers, and found inside the luggage a note from the US Miami airport security, that have inspected our luggage during the transfer, because thei scanner could not read it well!?!? we only had shoes and diving goggles inside. Plus all combination locks can be safely opened with a method that airport security should have. The luggage was now permanently damaged and not usable any longer. Mexicana told us that they were not responsible for this as the US security did the inspection. So we had to buy one new luggage for the return trip. "---" Playa del Carmen: Once arrived to the hotel Kimbe here we found the surprise, the junior suite #6 was not available beacuse occupied? so they gave us the one above, under the roof. 1st.the aircondition was old and extremely noisy when running. 2nd. the room was dirty and smelly, but after such long trip we decided not to argue anymore and just go to sleep. During the 1st. night we woke up several times during our sleep due to some kind of roaches climibing on our faces, not a nice feeling. The day after once we showed the, promptly killed, roaches to the manager she said, "OK they are not roaches they are wood insects", well it does not matter which kind of insect they are when they wake you up in the middle of the night because their legs tickle your neck or face. After a log argument with the manager about the room, that also costed 95USD per day (without breakfast), we managed to move to our original boked junior suite #6, as the people there were living that day. This room was nice and cleaner I have to say, but for 95USD x day it is definitely too much. Still the cleaning lady was not cleaning the bathroom properly, the service was really lousy. The place "Playa del Carmen": a shock! prices in general tripled after 7 years, and the Reality Business took over cementing appartments everywere. One could see that the Cancun or Acapulco style had started to take shape and ruin that place. Not anymore a little and quite hideaway. We'll never go back to Playa del Carmen or Mexico. For those that still have to discover it or conveninet because living in the Usa, and look for quite places to relax, we suggest to find small places along the Yucatan coast, south, such as Akumal, or other little villages away from the commercial areas. An all inclusive package it turns out to be much cheaper than just renting a room. I hope I have not been to tragic but we have been travelling a lot in the Caribbean and Mexico areas for both pleasure or business and during this recent trip we saw the changes in that particular area of Mexico. We want to thank again Tripadvisor for the help has given us when travelling around the World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessann98
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went last October. We didn't know what to expect, but for 4 nites @ $440.00 per person from Houston, it was fantastic. Staff very friendly and helpful as far as good places to eat and what trips/day excursions to take. We went to Chichen Itza...wow! That was awesome. The hotel is very very close to the beach. I rec. this place to anyone looking to take a vacation and not spend too much $$. Restaurants are as expensive if not more than restaurants here. Playa is a touristy place. you will find a TGI Fridays there. :( I expected 5th avenue (main street) to have vendors at "Mexico prices" nope...they wont even bargain with you. Waay over priced souv. items!! That was the only bad thing about playa del carmen.
